### CDS WEEKLY | VOLUME 6, ISSUE 5 | SEPTEMBER 30, 2025



Important Dates & Reminders:

Information and instructions on the¬†OPT¬†process (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/9t26dz). Please note that for the "Academic Advisor/Department Contact," please list Francheska Jimenez (fj6@nyu.edu (mailto:fj6@nyu.edu)) (MS), Kathryn Angeles (kangeles@nyu.edu (mailto:kangeles@nyu.edu)) (PhD), Timothy Baker (timothybaker@nyu.edu (mailto:timothybaker@nyu.edu)) (UG). Do not list your faculty advisor.
    * Fall 2025 graduates can begin filing your OPT request in September. Your completion date for the application is December 19, 2025 - the last day of the final exam period.

  * DS-GA 1009/CPT Guidelines for CDS Graduate Students:

    *
Internship Course and¬†CPT¬†Guidelines (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/pm36dz). At the latest, the completed package of required documents must be submitted to Tina Lam (tina.lam@nyu.edu) for approval by the first week of classes of the semester of enrollment.
    * International students requiring CPT approval must submit the required documents at least 3 weeks before their start date or by the first week of classes (whichever is earlier).

  * Monday, October 13: Fall Break
  * Tuesday, October 14: Legislative Monday - classes meet on a Monday schedule
  * Monday, October 20: Spring 2026 Schedule published





###  UPCOMING CDS EVENTS:

CDS Undergrad x Wasserman Center presents... The Professional Headshot Event! This is a great opportunity to capture a high-quality headshot for your LinkedIn, portfolio, or other professional materials. Whether you're polishing your profile or preparing for applications, this event is a simple way to put your best angle forward. Drop in and capture your best angle!

‚è∞ When: Friday, October 10, 1-3 PM
üìçWhere: Wasserman Union SQ, Presentation Room B

‚úâÔ∏è RSVP:
here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/5e46dz)!

*RSVP is required. NYU ID and CDS Sticker required to attend. Please note, this event is only open to CDS undergraduate students.


Research Series: Marie Bragg & Emily Balcetis (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/l746dz)

### CDS CLUB NEWS:

Introducing WiDS!

Women in Data Science (WiDS) at CDS is a student organization dedicated to fostering a supportive community in technology. Our mission is to inspire and empower women and allies in data science by creating spaces for connection and professional growth. Throughout the year, we will host a mix of events, from casual socials to professional development activities like resume workshops and coffee chats.

 Stay connected with us via: @cdswids on instagram,
Mailing List (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/9x96dz),
Discord (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/pqa7dz)


### CAREER TIP OF THE WEEK:

The interviewing process varies from company to company. For smaller companies: The technical screens will likely be more practical. Questions will be more relevant to the technologies and what you'll be using on the job and what they need to hire for. For large companies: The technical screens will likely be more theoretical. Think data structures and algorithms. Know your graphs and binary search trees and Big-O complexities! Check out the Career Advising page on the CDS Student Portal for more helpful resources.

### NYU NEWS & RESOURCES:

@NYU CAS

  *
Dean (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/5ib7dz)
| Fall 2025 Deadline: October 29

    * Dean's Undergraduate Research Fund Grant applications are open for the Fall 2025 semester! Eligible students can apply for funding for early-career training, to present at a conference, or to support an individual or team research project!

  *
Dean (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/lbc7dz)
| Deadline: December 1

    * The Dean's Opportunity Fund for Graduate School offers grants of up to $500 for expenses related to applying for a terminal degree program (MD, JD, MFA, MSW, PhD, and so on). Eligible expenses include test registration fees or application fees. Questions? Email cas.opportunity@nyu.edu



@NYU GSAS

  *
GSAS x Wasserman Internship Day (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/13c7dz)
| October 3, 1-5PM ET, Silver 120

    * This event is designed to help you navigate the world of graduate internships, providing you with the tools and insights to prepare application materials, find opportunities, and gain a competitive edge. This year, we're excited to welcome Jerry Lee of Wonsulting as our keynote speaker! As a former Senior Strategist for Google, a recognized LinkedIn Top Voice for Tech, and a TEDx speaker, Jerry will provide insight into navigating resume standards, share insider knowledge of hiring practices at top employers, and provide tips for networking, cold-calling, and maximizing your LinkedIn presence.

  *
How to Write Better Than a Chatbot: Developing your own voice and style (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/hwd7dz)
| October 3, 2:30-4PM ET, Silver 104

    * What makes an academic voice persuasive and memorable? This workshop is designed for graduate students seeking to develop their academic voices in their dissertations and publications. We'll also discuss how to both ethically and productively use Generative AI tools to enhance your writing. In order for you to flourish, you'll learn strategies on how to let your writing showcase your original mind as a budding scholar and NOT sound like a faceless bot. We'll also look at models of academic writing across the disciplines to see how authors make their scholarly interventions with grace and style. Participants will come away with strategies for enhancing their unique academic identity on the page, as well as a greater sense of their own agency as writers and thinkers.

  *
Call for Student Speakers! (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/xoe7dz)
| October 15-November 19

    * As a student speaker, your role will be to answer questions related to your experience as a NYU GSAS student during a Virtual Open House. A member of the GSAS admissions team will kick off the student speaker discussion with 2-4 questions. The chat will then be open for prospective students to ask questions. Typically prospective students ask about things like: balancing school workload / work (if applicable) , social life, adjusting to NYC, and finding housing. Please sign up below if you'd like to share your story!

  *
NYC Ghost Tour: Hauntings & Ghouls of Greenwich Village (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/dhf7dz)
| October 20, 6:30-7:30PM ET, Washington Square Park

    * Join the Master's College for a haunted walking tour! This New York haunted walking tour explores every dark corner of Greenwich Village to bring you the most authentic haunted tour in the city. Discover why so many New Yorkers are forever trapped in the city's iconic brownstones and parks due to malicious ends.

  *
One on One Writing Advisor appointments (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/t9f7dz)

    * GSAS master's students can sign up for free, one-on-one, 20-minute appointments with a writing advisor. Appointments can be in-person or over Zoom. Students can send materials they would like reviewed and a request for an appointment to gsas.writing@nyu.edu. Students are guaranteed an advisor appointment within 3 to 5 business days of asking for an appointment.

  *
Graduate Fellowship Finder (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/91g7dz)

    * Students seeking external fellowships opportunities should visit the Fellowship Finder. This database allows students to easily sort by field, citizenship, stage of study, and more.



@NYU Wasserman

  *
AI for Job-Seekers: The Right Way to Use AI to Accelerate the Job Search (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/puh7dz)
| September 30, 12PM-1PM ET, Virtual

    * AI feels like a miracle for job-seekers - instant resumes, cover letters, and more. What could be better? But there's a dark side to using AI in the job search: it can actually hurt your chances if you use it the wrong way. Understand AI from an employer's perspective, including:

      * The right way to use AI \- from the best prompting techniques to the best models for every stage of your search
      * The biggest pitfalls of AI \- and how to avoid them so your resume doesn't get automatically rejected
      * How to find your perfect career path, your most important resume keywords to beat the ATS, and your best interview prep plan of attack \- all by choosing the right AI tool at the right time!

  *
NYU Wasserman Presentation Competition (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/5mi7dz)
| Mandatory Orientation: September 30, 1PM-2PM ET, Wasserman USQ, Pres B / Competition: October 23, 5PM-7PM ET, Wasserman USQ

    * Improve your communication skills through our presentation competition! Learn how to share your stories and passions effectively in a short presentation format. Participants will be evaluated by judges from multinational companies and prizes will be awarded. Participants will be required to attend a mandatory orientation on September 30 as well as practice sessions.

  *
Undergrad Level Cover Letters (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/lfj7dz)
| September 30, 3PM-4PM ET, Wasserman Center USQ Pres Room A

    * This introductory workshop will go over what information to include in your cover letter, how to write persuasively about your experience, and formatting rules. This workshop is for students who have never written a cover letter before, or for those who need a reminder about basic guidelines.

  *
Career Conversations: Data Careers (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/17j7dz)
| September 30, 5PM-6:30PM ET, Virtual

    * A panel of industry professionals will share insights into their consulting careers. Q and A with the professionals will follow.

  *
Grad Level Networking (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/h0k7dz)
| October 1, 12PM-1PM ET, Wasserman Center USQ Pres Room A

    * Attend this workshop to assist you in identifying and leveraging skills acquired in graduate school and developing a strong professional story to bolster your networking skills.

  *
Biotech Careers Panel (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/xsl7dz)| October 6, 5PM-6:30PM ET, Virtual

    * Join us for this informative panel featuring professionals from across the biotech industry. Our panelists will share their career journeys, day-to-day roles, and insights on breaking into and succeeding in this evolving field. Whether you're just starting to explore this field or looking to pivot into biotech, this event is your chance to ask questions, network with industry insiders, and discover the diverse opportunities available in the life sciences.

  *
 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/dlm7dz)
% link:https://nyu-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2aDA10yp9Dz2C9vblqLWP31B39ZYWw0XLBs7zyMaQcjLtPx-bmQFrJFKWFEdY4mu6ljU70N671LYjoRMEVciPMYE0rhll-0gunkA0XkfDm_-Bgm0u5bIJZRWh-zDL4nncvufIOdYalQWyFHv1_x7_GADfgIKgTNdsYQkjnLfKmKm8r-4cT00qJj3A3iiGv1zbOWSsCkM name="nofollow noopener" content="Networking Reception: Connecting with International Alumni" %]
| October 7, 5:30PM-7PM ET, Wasserman Center USQ Pres Room A

    * Networking is key to having a successful career. Professional connections can be made in a variety of settings including work, conference and professional receptions. Join the Office ofGlobal Services, the Wasserman Center for Career Development and your fellow international students for an interactive and informative experience to learn how to conduct yourself professionally and expand your connections. Dress for the event is business casual. Appetizers will be served. This event is open only to NYU International Students.

  *
Internship Searching While You‚Äôre Still Exploring (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/tdn7dz)
| October 16, 2PM-3:15PM, Wasserman USQ Presentation Room A

    * Not sure what career path you want to take yet? That's okay! This interactive session is designated for students who are still figuring out their interests but want to gain valuable experience through internships. You'll learn how to identify opportunities that align with your strengths and curiosities, even if you don't have a clear "dream job" just yet. We'll cover strategies to find internships, tips on applying with limited experience, and ways to make the most of any role to help you explore future possibilities. Whether you're undecided or just curious, this workshop will give you the tools and confidence to start your internship search while keeping your options open.

  *
Join a Career Community today! (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/95n7dz)

    * Career Communities help you explore career paths, prepare for the job search, and connect with opportunities based on chosen industries. You can join as many Career Communities as you'd like to get personalized support and insider insights. Whether you're just starting out or getting ready to launch your career, there's a community for you.



@NYU University Life (CMEP/LGBTQ+ Center)

  *
Quench: International Solidarity (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/pyo7dz)
| October 8, 12:30-2PM ET, Kimmel 602

    * International students contribute unique perspectives, strengths, and experiences that enrich the NYU community, including within LGBTQ+ spaces. This Quench invites all students to join a conversation exploring the intersections of international student experiences and LGBTQ+ identity. Together, we'll share resources, build solidarity, and discuss how our communities can support one another. Free lunch will be provided!

  *
WERK THE STAGE! (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/5qp7dz)
| October 22, 6-8PM ET, Skirball

    * The LGBTQ+ Center and Center for Student Life bring you the first annual WERK THE STAGE! Hosted by Monet X Change from RuPaul's Drag Race, this talent show extravaganza will feature music, dance, drag, spoken word, and more--all performed by incredible NYU community members.

  *
Love Wins Food Pantry NYC (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/ljq7dz)

    * Love Wins NYC is a queer-centric and volunteer-led effort to address food insecurity in NYC. Love Wins distributes fresh and free produce to New Yorkers in locations across the city every month. They are always looking for donations and volunteers to help promote food justice, particularly for the LGBTQ+ immigrant community.



@NYU Global Spiritual Life

  *
Violet Voices Student Cohort Program (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/1br7dz)
| Deadline: October 3, 11:59PM ET

    * Violet Voices empowers students with the skills to engage in community dialogue and social change across lines of difference, to dive deeply into the work, leaning into vulnerability, processing, and application.

  * MindfulNYU Classes

    * MindfulNYU hosts a wide offering of
FREE yoga and meditation classes (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/h4r7dz)
throughout the week during the academic year. All classes are open to students, faculty, and staff with a current and valid NYU ID.



@NYU Office of Global Services

  *
English Conversation & Culture (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/xws7dz)
| Every Wednesday, 4-5PM, Kimmel 704

    * This interactive and informative series will explore topics like American academic culture, idioms and slang, and professional English conversation. It's a welcoming safe space for everyone to learn and practice--no need for notebooks or laptops, just bring yourself!



@NYU Libraries

  *
Introduction to Special Collections (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/dpt7dz)
| September 30, 2:30-3:30PM ET, Bobst 251

    * This session is geared towards students of all levels who are interested in using material from NYU Special Collections but are unsure how to begin. We'll discuss what types of materials and content you can find, demonstrate how to find material in the catalog and archival search portal, walk through the basic anatomy of a finding aid, and explain how to access the web archives. You'll also learn how to activate your Special Collections Research Account and how to schedule an appointment to visit.

  *
Introduction to Business Resources (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/thu7dz)
| October 1, 11AM-12PM ET, Virtual

    * This session aims to provide students with a navigation of the valuable resources available at the business library. We will start by offering an overview of the business library, enabling you to access a wide range of journal articles, industry reports, and key financial and economics databases. Additionally, students will learn how to effectively utilize other library services to assist you with any business-related inquiries and requests you may have.

  *
Sourcing Inspiration: Joy & Creativity in the Library (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/99u7dz)
| October 1, 11:30AM-1PM ET, Bobst 619

    * NYU libraries are not just for academic rigor--we are also here to help you connect with your curiosities, personal exploration, and creativity. This workshop will help you approach our vast catalog with a sense of wonderment and exploration, utilizing playful browsing methods that can help get you out of a rut, inspire you, feed your artistic needs, and invite radical joy into your library experience.

  *
Managing your research and bibliographies - ENDNOTE (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/p2v7dz)
| October 1, 1-2PM ET, Virtual

    * Learn how to organize your research by using an easy personal database called EndNote. The workshop will get you set up with your very own database, show you the basics of adding to and maintaining your database, and show you how to automatically create bibliographies in your desired style (APA, MLA, etc) directly from your account.

  *
Introduction to Machine Learning Clinic: A Project Walkthrough Session 4 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/5uw7dz)
| October 2, 1-2PM ET, Dibner LC 433

    * As a continuation from our last session, we'll be completing our model selection process for our project. Some python proficiency is helpful, though not needed as we'll be walking through each step. Please bring your own laptop, as computers will not be provided.

  *
Managing your research and bibliographies - ZOTERO (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/lnx7dz)
| October 3, 2-3PM ET, Virtual

    * Learn how to organize your research by using an open-source citation management tool called Zotero. The workshop will get you set up, show you the basics of adding to and maintaining your database, and show you how to automatically create bibliographies in your desired style (APA, MLA, etc) as you write.

  *
Intro to Credo Reference (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/1fy7dz)
| October 6, 12:30-1:30PM ET, Virtual

    * Looking for background information on a topic? Need help coming up with keywords and brainstorming your topic? Start your research with Credo Reference, a one-stop exploratory database where you can search hundreds of full-text articles on every subject. This workshop will explore how to access Credo Reference and use it to enhance the research process, learn new research skills, and explore various encyclopedias, dictionaries, atlases, and reference handbooks to get reliable and trustworthy background information on your topic.

  *
NYU Data Carpentry Workshop at Dibner Library (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/h8y7dz)
| October 8-9, 10AM-5PM ET, Dibner LC 433

    * In this two-day workshop, you'll learn new computing skills to help you get more done in less time, with less stress with research tools like regular expressions, the Unix shell, and Python. All skill levels are welcome.

  *
NYU Libraries Data Services Classes (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/x0z7dz)

    * Free courses ranging from Data Visualization with Tableau to Data Wrangling in R and Python for Harvesting Data on the Web to Writing a Data Management Plan for Grant Applications.

      *
Principles of Finding Data (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/dt07dz): September 30, 12:30-1:30PM ET, Bobst 743
      *
Introduction to Git and GitHub (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/tl17dz): October 2, 2-4PM ET, Bobst 617



@NYU Writing Center

  *
Writing Workshops (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/9d27dz)

    * Need help with your writing? (We all do!) Need help organizing an essay? Want to make your sentences clearer and more concise? Unsure of where to start with articulating a research problem? This semester, the Expository Writing Program at NYU is offering a set of remote and in person writing / research workshops for all undergraduates and MAs.



@NYU Student Health Center

  *
Free Flu Shot Pop-Up Clinics (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/p627dz)

    * The Student Health Center is hosting a free flu shot pop-up clinics. Anyone can get the flu, and it can be serious. Getting vaccinated can help prevent you from getting the flu, stop you from spreading the flu to others, make your illness milder if you do get sick, and prevent complications like pneumonia. Can't make it? No worries! Make an appointment or find another upcoming flu pop-up clinic at
nyu.edu/flu (https://t.e2ma.net/click/5estrh/dt03qtsf/5y37dz).
    * October 8, 12-4PM ET, School of Global Public Health, 708 Broadway, 3rd Floor Lounge
    * October 16, 12-4PM ET, Stern, 40 W 4th St, L101 Kassin Center





###      END.

### CDS CLUB NEWS:

Introducing WiDS!

Women in Data Science (WiDS) at CDS is a student organization dedicated to fostering a supportive community in technology. Our mission is to inspire and empower women and allies in data science by creating spaces for connection and professional growth. Throughout the year, we will host a mix of events, from casual socials to professional development activities like resume workshops and coffee chats.

Interested? Join us at our Launch Party, our first event of the year, this Friday, to learn more. Our events are always open to all CDS students. Click
here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/9p7jcz)
to rsvp! Stay connected with us via: @cdswids on instagram,
Mailing List (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/pi8jcz),
Discord (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/5a9jcz)


Amidst the academic chaos, are you ready to unwind while being curious about joining an empowering, inclusive community at CDS? Join us for the launch party of Women in Data Science (WiDS) on Friday, September 26th, from 3-5 PM in the CDS Open Space!

Come connect with the CDS community for a fun afternoon featuring our mission, a preview of the year ahead, free food, and a round of Jeopardy.

Our events are open to all CDS students--stop by, say hi, and maybe even win some CDS merch during this very first one! ü•≥ RSVP here:
https://cdsfall2025WiDSlaunchparty.eventbrite.com (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/l39jcz)


### CAREER TIP OF THE WEEK:

Don't skip the cover letter!: A cover letter is an important way to showcase how your unique combination of skills and experience meet the key requirements of the job description. A good cover letter follows a simple formula that you can apply to every single job you apply for: Who - Who you are. Easy enough. Where - Where you're coming from. Why - Why you're interested in this company, and show that you researched them. What - What you can bring to the table. When - When you're available to start, and when they can contact you. How - How they can reach you. Check out the Career Advising page on the CDS Student Portal for more helpful resources.

### NYU NEWS & RESOURCES:

September is a flurry of climate action at NYU!

and explore all the events happening across NYU for Climate Week. From service days to panels to film screenings and more, there's an event for every climate optimist.

@NYU CAS

| Deadline: September 26

The GSAS Mentorship Program aims to enhance graduate students' growth at NYU and facilitate student success. This peer-to-peer mentorship program matches students across disciplines and departments based on student interests and demographic preferences. The Mentor application is open to 2nd year and beyond Master's and Ph.D. students within GSAS.

  *

    * GSAS master's students can sign up for free, one-on-one, 20-minute appointments with a writing advisor. Appointments can be in-person or over Zoom. Students can send materials they would like reviewed and a request for an appointment to gsas.writing@nyu.edu. Students are guaranteed an advisor appointment within 3 to 5 business days of asking for an appointment.

  *
Graduate Fellowship Finder (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/9tekcz)

    * Students seeking external fellowships opportunities should visit the Fellowship Finder. This database allows students to easily sort by field, citizenship, stage of study, and more.



@NYU Wasserman

  *
Designing a Portfolio Website Series Session 1 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/pmfkcz)
| September 23, 12PM-1PM ET, Virtual

    * This virtual, introductory workshop will outline the content and best practices for a portfolio website. This presentation includes a brand assessment exercise where participants will determine how to assess and develop the visual aesthetic, language/verbiage, and content presented on their website. This workshop is open to undergraduate, graduate, and alumni. Future sessions on October 7 from 12PM-1:30PM, October 21 from 12PM-1PM, and December 5 from 11:30AM-1:30PM will cover resources and specific tools and technologies participants can use to create their portfolio websites, a live demo on how to craft a website using Wix, open work time, and will conclude with a website demonstration.

  *
Ask an Alum: Launching Your Career (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/5egkcz)
| September 25, 1PM-2PM ET, Wasserman Center USQ Pres Room A

    * As part of our Ask the Expert Series, get an insider scoop navigating the job market from an alum who will share their job search journey. Build your confidence, expand your network, and find answers to your most important career questions through expert advice and interactive activities in a relaxed setting.

  *
International Student Career Series: Networking for International Students Panel (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/l7gkcz)
| September 29, 5:30PM-7:00PM ET, Virtual

    * Listen as a panel of alumni from various industries share best practices and tips when networking in the United States. Q and A with the panelists will follow. This is part of the International Student Career Series. Undergraduate & graduate students are welcome to attend.

  *
LinkedIn Rock Your Profile (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/1zhkcz)
| September 29, 12PM-1PM ET, Virtual

    * LinkedIn as a virtual tool is more important than ever for staying relevant and connected. Learn strategies for creating an effective profile for job searching and networking from a LinkedIn representative. Q & A will follow.

  *
AI for Job-Seekers: The Right Way to Use AI to Accelerate the Job Search (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/hsikcz)
| September 30, 12PM-1PM ET, Virtual

    * AI feels like a miracle for job-seekers - instant resumes, cover letters, and more. What could be better? But there's a dark side to using AI in the job search: it can actually hurt your chances if you use it the wrong way. Understand AI from an employer's perspective, including:

      * The right way to use AI \- from the best prompting techniques to the best models for every stage of your search
      * The biggest pitfalls of AI \- and how to avoid them so your resume doesn't get automatically rejected
      * How to find your perfect career path, your most important resume keywords to beat the ATS, and your best interview prep plan of attack \- all by choosing the right AI tool at the right time!

  *
NYU Wasserman Presentation Competition (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/xkjkcz)
| Mandatory Orientation: September 30, 1PM-2PM ET, Wasserman USQ, Pres B / Competition: October 23, 5PM-7PM ET, Wasserman USQ

    * Improve your communication skills through our presentation competition! Learn how to share your stories and passions effectively in a short presentation format. Participants will be evaluated by judges from multinational companies and prizes will be awarded. Participants will be required to attend a mandatory orientation on September 30 as well as practice sessions.

  *
Undergrad Level Cover Letters (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/ddkkcz)
| September 30, 3PM-4PM ET, Wasserman Center USQ Pres Room A

This workshop is for students who have never written a cover letter before, or for those who need a reminder about basic guidelines.

  *
Career Conversations: Data Careers (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/t5kkcz)
| September 30, 5PM-6:30PM ET, Virtual

Grad Level Networking (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/9xlkcz)
| October 1, 12PM-1PM ET, Wasserman Center USQ Pres Room A

  *

You can join as many Career Communities as you'd like to get personalized support and insider insights. Whether you're just starting out or getting ready to launch your career, there's a community for you.



@NYU University Life (CMEP/LGBTQ+ Center)

    * Love Wins NYC is a queer-centric and volunteer-led effort to address food insecurity in NYC. Love Wins distributes fresh and free produce to New Yorkers in locations across the city every month. They are always looking for donations and volunteers to help promote food justice, particularly for the LGBTQ+ immigrant community.



@NYU Global Spiritual Life

  *

These non-credit classes combine best practices from a well-being context with both Buddhist and secular mindfulness/meditation approaches. Classes will run from September 29th to December 12, 2025.

  * MindfulNYU Classes

    * MindfulNYU hosts a wide offering of
FREE yoga and meditation classes (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/xoqkcz)
throughout the week during the academic year. All classes are open to students, faculty, and staff with a current and valid NYU ID.

  *
English Conversation & Culture (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/t9rkcz)
| Every Wednesday, 4-5PM, Kimmel 704

@NYU Libraries

  *
Welcome to the Studio: A humanist‚Äôs intro to VS Code for programming and GitHub control (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/91skcz)
| September 24, 11AM-12:30PM ET, Virtual

    * Many starting digital humanists and qualitative researchers imagine computer programming in terms of the scary blank page of a Terminal window or maybe even the haunting green of binary from the Matrix. Coding doesn't have to look this way, and Visual Studio Code provides an integrated, flexible, and approachable interface for coding in several programming languages that anyone can use. Participants in this workshop will be introduced to the layout and features of VS Code as well as a basic introduction to pushing, pulling, and synching with GitHub through the interface. No programming skills are required, though participants will benefit from having attended Data Services' "Introduction to Git and GitHub" workshop and from any previous familiarity they have with programming languages.

  *
AI Essentials (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/putkcz)
| September 24, 12-1:30PM ET, Bobst 619

    * Attendees of this workshop will be whisked through a 60-minute presentation that reviews the building blocks of artificial intelligence (AI), briefly touching on: the history of AI, how these systems affect our physical, social, political, legal, economic, and information landscape, how these technologies work, and what this means in the context of conducting academic research. The goal of the session is to help participants think critically about AI on a range of scales.

  *
NYU Libraries for Beginners (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/5mukcz)
| September 24, 3-4PM ET, Virtual

    * This workshop will help you get comfortable navigating NYU Libraries' online and physical environment. How do you get books? What about study spaces? We want to welcome you to our spaces and let you know what to expect. We'll do a quick walkthrough of the library website and provide an overview of where to look for books, articles, and other research sources. You'll also find out about services and discover the various ways to get research help.

  *
The 2-Hour Job Search: Strategies for creating your company list (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/lfvkcz)
| September 25, 8-9:30AM ET, Virtual

    * Ready to start a more strategic and efficient job search?  Learn to master the principles of Steve Dalton's "The 2-Hour Job Search" method. This workshop will focus on the critical first step: building your prioritized LAMP (List, Alumni, Motivation, Posting) list. Through hands-on exercises, you will use some of the library's business databases, such as Pitchbook, Hoovers, Capital IQ, and GlobalData Disruptor, to identify potential employers, find valuable company information, and uncover alumni connections--all key steps for turning your job search into a strategic and efficient process.

  *
Introduction to Machine Learning Clinic: A Project Walkthrough Session 3 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/17vkcz)
| September 25, 1-2PM ET, Dibner LC 433

    * In this next session of our series, we'll be starting to look at different models to find one that best fits our data. Some python proficiency is helpful, though not required since we'll be walking through each step. Please bring your own laptops, as a computer will not be provided.

This semester, the Expository Writing Program at NYU is offering a set of remote and in person writing / research workshops for all undergraduates and MAs.



@NYU Student Health Center

Free Flu Shot Pop-Up Clinics (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/dlykcz)

    * The Student Health Center is hosting a free flu shot pop-up clinics. Anyone can get the flu, and it can be serious. Getting vaccinated can help prevent you from getting the flu, stop you from spreading the flu to others, make your illness milder if you do get sick, and prevent complications like pneumonia. Can't make it? No worries! Make an appointment or find another upcoming flu pop-up clinic at
nyu.edu/flu (https://t.e2ma.net/click/1n8crh/dt03qtsf/tdzkcz).

    * October 8, 12-4PM ET, School of Global Public Health, 708 Broadway, 3rd Floor Lounge

###  UPCOMING CDS EVENTS:

### CDS CLUB NEWS:

### CAREER TIP OF THE WEEK:

Searching for roles: To make the search process a little easier, you can set up job alerts on Google and LinkedIn for roles you are looking for. I.e., 'Data Science Intern' or 'Data Engineer'. If you haven't already, make sure you join the CDS LinkedIn Job Board for opportunities that we come across or get shared with us. Get your resume and cover letter ready for applying to a LOT of roles. In order to expand your options, you may find yourself applying for several jobs a day when you're on the job hunt. It's tedious, but it's a numbers game. Check out the Career Advising page on the CDS Student Portal for more helpful resources

### NYU NEWS & RESOURCES:

@NYU CAS

  *
Dean (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/996obz)
| Fall 2025 Deadline: October 29

    * Dean's Undergraduate Research Fund Grant applications are open for the Fall 2025 semester! Eligible students can apply for funding for early-career training, to present at a conference, or to support an individual or team research project!

@NYU GSAS

| September 16, 7:10PM ET, Amity Hall

    * Join GSAS for an evening of food, drinks, and meaningful conversations with fellow students, student organizations, and key NYU departments that will support you throughout your journey here. This event is open to all students, and offers a wonderful opportunity to connect with both new and returning GSAS peers of all backgrounds.

  *

| September 19, 2:30-4PM ET, Silver 104

    * Graduate work demands arduous writing: finishing your thesis, scholarly publications, job letters and applications, written exams and final papers. Rethinking how you approach your writing for classwork or publication will help you to flourish. Writers who complete the workshop will learn tips to build good habits and effective strategies to beat demotivation, distraction, negative feedback, and writer's block.

  *
One on One Writing Advisor appointments (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/1fapbz)

    * GSAS master's students can sign up for free, one-on-one, 20-minute appointments with a writing advisor. Appointments can be in-person or over Zoom. Students can send materials they would like reviewed and a request for an appointment to gsas.writing@nyu.edu. Students are guaranteed an advisor appointment within 3 to 5 business days of asking for an appointment.

  *
Graduate Fellowship Finder (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/h8apbz)

    * Students seeking external fellowships opportunities should visit the Fellowship Finder. This database allows students to easily sort by field, citizenship, stage of study, and more.

| September 16, 2PM-3:30PM ET, Virtual

    * Are you an international student seeking an internship or full-time employment in the United States? Participate in this workshop to learn about valuable strategies for navigating the U.S. internship and job search. Topics include search resources for F-1 students, networking, the application process in the U.S., and considerations for CPT and OPT.

  *
First-Generation Career Exploration Program (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/tldpbz)
| Deadline: September 21

    * Calling all first-generation freshmen! Apply today to the First-Generation Career Exploration Program. This fall semester cohort program is designed to support first-year students who are eager to explore their identity, build foundational career skills, and grow their professional confidence. This program is free and open to all NYU first-generation freshmen, inclusive of all racial and ethnic backgrounds and inclusive of those of any gender identities/expressions or sexual orientations. If you have any questions, please email career.diversity@nyu.edu.

  *
Transform Your Career with NYU (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/9depbz)
| Deadline: September 22

    * Join NYU's International Student Career Academy, an engaging five-session program tailored to empower international students with the skills, strategies, and confidence needed to thrive in the U.S. job market. Don't miss this opportunity! Learn more by
viewing the program flyer (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/p6epbz)
and submit your application by September 22, 2025, to secure your spot.

  *
Violet Internship & Research Award (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/5yfpbz)
| Second Deadline: October 9, 11:59PM ET

    * Are you pursuing an unpaid internship or research position at a nonprofit, government agency, social service organization, or arts organization this fall? Apply to receive up to $1200 with new eligibility criteria and application materials. Check out our website for more information.

  *
Join a Career Community today! (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/lrgpbz)

    * Career Communities help you explore career paths, prepare for the job search, and connect with opportunities based on chosen industries. You can join as many Career Communities as you'd like to get personalized support and insider insights. Whether you're just starting out or getting ready to launch your career, there's a community for you.



@NYU University Life (CMEP/LGBTQ+ Center)

  *
Consent Zone (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/1jhpbz)
| September 16, 12-1PM ET, Kimmel 903

    * Consent Zone participants will gain a greater understanding of what affirmative consent means within the NYU community. This workshop is open to both undergraduate and graduate students.

  *
#Shhh30 Prince *VIRTUAL* Symposium (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/hcipbz)
| September 20-September 21, Virtual

    * This is a *VIRTUAL* symposium celebrating the 30th anniversary of Prince's The Gold Experience and The NPG's Exodus. #Shhh30 is the 10th polished solid Prince symposium + the 15th Prince event, curated by De Angela L. Duff.

  *
Graduate Student Leadership Summit (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/x4ipbz)
| September 26, 11AM-3PM ET, Kimmel 804/5

    * Join the NYU Changemaker Center and CMEP in an annual summit that invites graduate students and alums for reflection, dialogue, and community building. This year, the Summit will explore the power of questioning as a tool for transformation, challenging assumptions, and unlocking new possibilities.

  *
Become a 2025-2026 FOCUS Mentee! (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/dxjpbz)
| Deadline: September 28 11:59PM ET

    * FOCUS Mentorship Program connects first and second-year, first-generation students with NYU alum, faculty, staff, and graduate mentors. Through FOCUS, mentees gain confidence, explore passions, and build community at NYU.

  *
Love Wins Food Pantry NYC (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/tpkpbz)

    * Love Wins NYC is a queer-centric and volunteer-led effort to address food insecurity in NYC. Love Wins distributes fresh and free produce to New Yorkers in locations across the city every month. They are always looking for donations and volunteers to help promote food justice, particularly for the LGBTQ+ immigrant community.



@NYU Global Spiritual Life

  * Walking Meditation to Pier 45 with MindfulNYU | September 15, 10-11:15AM

    * Begin your week with connection and join our walking meditation! We will meet outside the GCASL building and begin our contemplative walk to Pier 45. Walking together, we will be invited into a combination of mindfulness practices that foster connection, curiosity, and community. No experience required--just bring comfortable shoes and an open heart. If you have any questions, please reach out to mindfulness@nyu.edu.

  * MindfulNYU Classes

    * MindfulNYU hosts a wide offering of
FREE yoga and meditation classes (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/9hlpbz)
throughout the week during the academic year. All classes are open to students, faculty, and staff with a current and valid NYU ID.



@NYU Office of Global Services

  *
Give Where You Live (GWYL) (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/pampbz)
| Deadline: September 19

    * GWYL is a six-week service-learning experience. Students work with administrators, faculty, and peer leaders to learn about and take action on a social justice issue. Founded on education, action, and reflection, GWYL is an immersive approach to deepening understanding of complex problems while engaging with community organizations.

  *
Passport Drive for US Citizens (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/52mpbz)
| September 26, StudentLink

    * Apply for or renew your US passport! The NYU Office of Global Services is offering Passport Acceptance events in partnership with the New York Passport Agency. This aims to help NYU community members get their US travel document, especially students planning to study abroad in the near future.

  *
English Conversation & Culture (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/lvnpbz)
| Every Wednesday, 4-5PM, Kimmel 704

    * This interactive and informative series will explore topics like American academic culture, idioms and slang, and professional English conversation. It's a welcoming safe space for everyone to learn and practice--no need for notebooks or laptops, just bring yourself!



@NYU Libraries

  *
Introduction to Data Services (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/1nopbz)
| September 16, 3-4PM ET, Bobst 619

    * This session is meant to give participants an introduction to the services offered by Data Services. We'll discuss the software licensing, instruction, and consultations offered by Data Services to assist researchers with their data-related projects.

  *
Intro to Machine Learning Clinic: A Project Walkthrough Session 2 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/hgppbz)
| September 19, 1-2PM ET, Dibner LC 433

    * In this second session, we'll continue exploratory data analysis along with other data cleaning techniques. Some basic python proficiency is helpful, though not necessary since we will be walking through each step during the workshop. Please bring your own laptops, as computers will not be provided.

  *
Introduction of Global Business & Economics Data Resources (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/x8ppbz)
| September 22, 9-10AM ET, Virtual

    * The Global Business & Economics Data Workshop kickoff session will introduce participants to the Business Library Guide, the business librarian team, and key business and economic data resources available through our collections. It will also provide an overview of the upcoming workshop series, highlighting how these sessions are designed to support students and researchers in navigating, accessing, and effectively using data for academic and professional projects. This session will help you get started and make the most of the resources available in the library's collection.

  *
Getting Started with Company Research (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/d1qpbz)
| September 23, 8-9AM ET, Virtual

    * Learn to navigate and utilize the powerful business databases available through NYU Libraries. This session will provide hands-on experience using resources like Hoovers, Nexis Uni, and Capital IQ to access essential company information. You will gain the skills to retrieve data on financial statements, stock market performance, executive compensation, earning call transcripts and more.

  *
Welcome to the Studio: A humanist‚Äôs intro to VS Code for programming and GitHub control (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/ttrpbz)
| September 24, 11AM-12:30PM ET, Virtual

    * Many starting digital humanists and qualitative researchers imagine computer programming in terms of the scary blank page of a Terminal window or maybe even the haunting green of binary from the Matrix. Coding doesn't have to look this way, and Visual Studio Code provides an integrated, flexible, and approachable interface for coding in several programming languages that anyone can use. Participants in this workshop will be introduced to the layout and features of VS Code as well as a basic introduction to pushing, pulling, and synching with GitHub through the interface. No programming skills are required, though participants will benefit from having attended Data Services' "Introduction to Git and GitHub" workshop and from any previous familiarity they have with programming languages.

  *
AI Essentials (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/9lspbz)
| September 24, 12-1:30PM ET, Bobst 619

    * Attendees of this workshop will be whisked through a 60-minute presentation that reviews the building blocks of artificial intelligence (AI), briefly touching on: the history of AI, how these systems affect our physical, social, political, legal, economic, and information landscape, how these technologies work, and what this means in the context of conducting academic research. The goal of the session is to help participants think critically about AI on a range of scales.

  *
NYU Libraries for Beginners (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/petpbz)
| September 24, 3-4PM ET, Virtual

    * This workshop will help you get comfortable navigating NYU Libraries' online and physical environment. How do you get books? What about study spaces? We want to welcome you to our spaces and let you know what to expect. We'll do a quick walkthrough of the library website and provide an overview of where to look for books, articles, and other research sources. You'll also find out about services and discover the various ways to get research help.

  *
The 2-Hour Job Search: Strategies for creating your company list (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/56tpbz)
| September 25, 8-9:30AM ET, Virtual

    * Ready to start a more strategic and efficient job search?  Learn to master the principles of Steve Dalton's "The 2-Hour Job Search" method. This workshop will focus on the critical first step: building your prioritized LAMP (List, Alumni, Motivation, Posting) list. Through hands-on exercises, you will use some of the library's business databases, such as Pitchbook, Hoovers, Capital IQ, and GlobalData Disruptor, to identify potential employers, find valuable company information, and uncover alumni connections--all key steps for turning your job search into a strategic and efficient process.

  *
Introduction to Machine Learning Clinic: A Project Walkthrough Session 3 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/lzupbz)
| September 25, 1-2PM ET, Dibner LC 433

    * In this next session of our series, we'll be starting to look at different models to find one that best fits our data. Some python proficiency is helpful, though not required since we'll be walking through each step. Please bring your own laptops, as a computer will not be provided.

  *
NYU Libraries Classes (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/1rvpbz)

    * Free courses ranging from Data Visualization with Tableau to Data Wrangling in R and Python for Harvesting Data on the Web to Writing a Data Management Plan for Grant Applications.



@NYU Writing Center

  *
Writing Workshops (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/hkwpbz)

    * Need help with your writing? (We all do!) Need help organizing an essay? Want to make your sentences clearer and more concise? Unsure of where to start with articulating a research problem? This semester, the Expository Writing Program at NYU is offering a set of remote and in person writing / research workshops for all undergraduates and MAs.



@NYU Student Health Center

  *
Free Flu Shot Pop-Up Clinics (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/xcxpbz)

    * The Student Health Center is hosting a free flu shot pop-up clinics. Anyone can get the flu, and it can be serious. Getting vaccinated can help prevent you from getting the flu, stop you from spreading the flu to others, make your illness milder if you do get sick, and prevent complications like pneumonia. Can't make it? No worries! Make an appointment or find another upcoming flu pop-up clinic at
nyu.edu/flu (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/d5xpbz).
    * September 25, 12-4PM ET, School of Law, 40 Washington Sq South, Kushner Lounge
    * October 8, 12-4PM ET, School of Global Public Health, 708 Broadway, 3rd Floor Lounge
    * October 16, 12-4PM ET, Stern, 40 W 4th St, L101 Kassin Center





###     END.


 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/txypbz)
 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/9pzpbz)

Francheska Jimenez
Assistant Director of Academic & Student Affairs
fj6@nyu.edu (mailto:fj6@nyu.edu)

Caleb Chrisley
Undergraduate Program Administrator
calebchrisley@nyu.edu (mailto:calebchrisley@nyu.edu)


NYU CDS Form for Feedback/Issues/Suggestions (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf/pi0pbz)


60 5th Avenue, 7th Floor, New York, NY 10011

[Unsubscribe](https://t.e2ma.net/optout/dhn1qh/dt03qtsf?s=u4yJKusQgz-f_Mhw_CazElD-8qfwGHUIlKoEYUjGAcI)  |  [Manage your preferences](https://app.e2ma.net/app2/audience/signup/2013864/1982351/451413903/432180021135/?s=80hfW_iCslx4i_rRFUDfp5Bj9dHZEb04N9LgQk3PBTA)

subject: CDS Weekly | Volume 6, Issue 1
body:
NYU



### CDS WEEKLY | VOLUME 6, ISSUE 2 | SEPTEMBER 8, 2025



Important Dates & Reminders:

  * DS-GA 1009/CPT Guidelines for CDS Graduate Students:

    *
Internship Course and¬†CPT¬†Guidelines (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/d12iaz). At the latest, the completed package of required documents must be submitted to Tina Lam (tina.lam@nyu.edu) for approval by the first week of classes of the semester of enrollment.
    * International students requiring CPT approval must submit the required documents at least 3 weeks before their start date or by the first week of classes (whichever is earlier).

  * Monday, September 15:

    * Last day to add/drop on Albert
    * Last day of waiting lists
    * Last day to drop course and receive 100% refund
    * Last day to drop course and not receive a "W" (withdrawal) on your transcript.

  * Monday, October 13: Fall Break





### UPCOMING CDS EVENTS:


Join us on Friday, September 12th from 4:30-6:30pm in the CDS Open Space for our annual Welcome (Back) Event for graduate students! Catch up with returning classmates and get to know the incoming cohort. There will be dinner, drinks, music, board games, and ping pong!. Registration is required to attend via Eventbrite:
https://cdsfall2025gradwelcome.eventbrite.com (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/tt3iaz)

Note: This event is open to CDS graduate students only. Please make sure to have your NYU ID with the CDS sticker ready at check-in.


What the heck does a data scientist do? (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/9l4iaz)
(UG) | 9/9/2025, 5-6PM | CDS Open Space

CILVR Seminar: Yann Lecun (All) | 9/10/2025, 2:30-4PM | CDS Open Space

Research 101 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/pe5iaz)
(UG) | 9/10/2025, 5-6PM | CDS Open Space

MaD Seminar: Eshaan Nichani (All) | 9/11/2025, 2-3PM | 60FA 150

I know what you did last summer - Internship Panel (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/565iaz)
(UG) | 9/11/2025, 5-6PM | CDS Open Space

CDS Grad Welcome Event (MS/PhD) | 9/12/2025, 4:30-6:30PM | CDS Open Space

Research Series: Sonali McDermid (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/lz6iaz)
(UG/MS) | 9/15/2025, 2-3PM | CDS 204

Research Series: Alejandra Ortiz (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/1r7iaz)
(UG/MS) | 9/17/2025, 2-3PM | CDS 204

CILVR Seminar: Karen Ullrich (All) | 9/17/2025, 3:30-5PM | CDS 206

Company Information Session: NBA, Oklahoma City Thunder (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/hk8iaz)
(UG/MS) | 9/17/2025, 3:30-4:30PM | CDS Open Space

TaD Seminar: Naomi Saphra (All) | 9/18/2025, 11AM-12PM | CDS Open Space

Career Fair Prep Workshop (MS/PhD) | 9/18/2025, 3:30-4:30PM | CDS Open Space

CDS Undergrad Alumni Panel (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/xc9iaz)
(UG) | 9/18/2025, 5-6PM | CDS Open Space

CDS Undegrad Welcome Back Event (UG) | 9/19/2025, 1-3PM | CDS Open Space



### CDS CLUB NEWS:

Join Data Science Club at our Fall 2025 Kick-off Event on Friday, September 12th, from 4:30 PM to 5:30 PM at Silver 206 (31 Washington Pl).

This is the perfect opportunity to:

\- Meet current E-board members and learn more their the roles,

\- Get your questions answered about the DSC, and

\- Find out how you can contribute to the club this semester.

But that's not all! The Kick-off Event will also feature:

\- A chance to mingle with fellow data science enthusiasts, and

\- A sneak peek at the exciting events and programs we have planned for the semester.

Don't miss this chance to connect, learn, and get involved. We can't wait to see you there!

RSVP Here! (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/d59iaz)

   *Note: This event is only open to declared undergraduate students. RSVP is required.

### CAREER TIP OF THE WEEK:

Highlight your achievements. A strong portfolio is essential to your success. It shows that you've moved from foundational knowledge to advanced skills, can think creatively, and that you're proud of your work. Portfolios are living documents, websites, or blogs that should be tended to as you complete projects. As you continue to curate your portfolio and present your hard work, your milestones and achievements will start to take on a streamlined narrative. Utilizing a digital portfolio allows you to mention it to anyone you meet, because you never know when you may meet a potential employer, colleague, or mentor. Check out the Career Advising page on the CDS Student Portal for more helpful resources.

### NYU NEWS & RESOURCES:

@NYU CAS

  *
Dean (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/txajaz)
| Fall 2025 Deadline: October 29

    * Dean's Undergraduate Research Fund Grant applications are open for the Fall 2025 semester! Eligible students can apply for funding for early-career training, to present at a conference, or to support an individual or team research project!

  *
Dean (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/9pbjaz)
| Deadline: December 1

    * The Dean's Opportunity Fund for Graduate School offers grants of up to $500 for expenses related to applying for a terminal degree program (MD, JD, MFA, MSW, PhD, and so on). Eligible expenses include test registration fees or application fees. Questions? Email cas.opportunity@nyu.edu



@NYU GSAS

  *
GSAS Multicultural Welcome (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/picjaz)
| September 9, 5:30-7:30PM ET, Silverstein Lounge

    * Ready for a thrilling Mets vs. Padres showdown? Join the Master's College to see the San Diego Padres at New York Mets Citi Field in Flushing, NY! Tickets are limited and will be chosen at random.

  *
Mets v. Padres Baseball Game (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/5adjaz)
| September 16, 7:10PM ET, Amity Hall

    * Join GSAS for an evening of food, drinks, and meaningful conversations with fellow students, student organizations, and key NYU departments that will support you throughout your journey here. This event is open to all students, and offers a wonderful opportunity to connect with both new and returning GSAS peers of all backgrounds.

  *
Faster, Better, Easier Writing: Cultivating Good Writing Habits (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/l3djaz)
| September 19, 2:30-4PM ET, Silver 104

    * Graduate work demands arduous writing: finishing your thesis, scholarly publications, job letters and applications, written exams and final papers. Rethinking how you approach your writing for classwork or publication will help you to flourish. Writers who complete the workshop will learn tips to build good habits and effective strategies to beat demotivation, distraction, negative feedback, and writer's block.

  *
One on One Writing Advisor appointments (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/1vejaz)

    * GSAS master's students can sign up for free, one-on-one, 20-minute appointments with a writing advisor. Appointments can be in-person or over Zoom. Students can send materials they would like reviewed and a request for an appointment to gsas.writing@nyu.edu. Students are guaranteed an advisor appointment within 3 to 5 business days of asking for an appointment.

  *
Graduate Fellowship Finder (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/hofjaz)

    * Students seeking external fellowships opportunities should visit the Fellowship Finder. This database allows students to easily sort by field, citizenship, stage of study, and more.



@NYU Wasserman

  *
Ask a Peer: Small Talk in the U.S. (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/xggjaz)
| September 9, 1PM-2PM ET, Wasserman USQ, Presentation Room A

    * As part of our Ask the Expert Series, learn from your fellow students as you practice small talk typical in the workplace and other professional spaces. Build your confidence, expand your network, and find answers to your most important career questions through peer-to-peer advice and interactive activities in a relaxed setting.

  *
Undergrad Level Resumes (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/d9gjaz)
| September 9, 3PM-4PM ET, Wasserman USQ, Presentation Room A

    * This introductory workshop will go over what kind of information to include on your resume, how to write about your experience, and formatting rules. This workshop is for students who have never written a resume before, or for those who need a reminder about basic guidelines.

  *
CaseCoach: Case Interview Foundations (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/t1hjaz)
| September 9, 5PM-6:30PM ET, Virtual

    * In this session, you'll learn how to approach the case interview - common to the selection process for management consulting firms and other top employers around the world. This class is designed to get students started with preparation by familiarizing them with the key skills that case interviewers are seeking in candidates.

  *
Graduate Student Advisory Board (GSAB) Applications (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/9tijaz)
| Deadline: September 9

    * Do you know a student interested in using their voice to impact graduate career services? If yes, encourage them to apply for the Wasserman Center Graduate Student Advisory Board (GSAB). GSAB members serve as a liaison between graduate students and the Wasserman Grad Team, collaborate on projects with students from across NYU, and make a difference for the graduate student community.

  *
Breaking Into Finance Without a Finance Degree Panel (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/pmjjaz)
| September 10, 5:30PM-7PM, Wasserman USQ, Presentation Room A

    * Curious about a career in finance but not a finance major? Join us for a dynamic panel designed specifically for students from non-finance backgrounds who are interested in exploring opportunities in the finance industry. Learn how to leverage your liberal arts or non-finance education to break into the field, gain insight into different career paths in finance, and understand how your skills can translate across roles.

  *
Violet Internship & Research Award (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/5ekjaz)
| First Deadline: September 11, 11:59PM ET / Second Deadline: October 9, 11:59PM ET

    * Are you pursuing an unpaid internship or research position at a nonprofit, government agency, social service organization, or arts organization this fall? Apply to receive up to $1200 with new eligibility criteria and application materials. Check out our website for more information.

  *
On-Campus Employment for F-1 & J-1 Students (Multiple) (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/l7kjaz)
| September 12, 12:30PM-1:30PM ET, Virtual

    * Are you an F-1 or J-1 international student who just started (or wants to start) working on campus? This workshop covers what kind of documentation you will be expected to have, how to apply for your Social Security Number (SSN), and a review of tax resources for non-residents. Learn the basics of this process and get key information on what to expect as you find your on-campus job. Co-sponsored with OGS.

  *
Doctoral and Postdoc Faculty Job Search Workshop and Panel (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/1zljaz)
| September 12, 10AM-1:30PM ET, Virtual

    * Learn about job search strategies specific to doctoral students and postdocs who are looking to pursue a faculty career path. Mini-workshops will cover the preparation of documents for your faculty job search, including: CVs, academic cover letters, research statements, and teaching portfolios. Following the workshops, learn from a panel of insightful faculty about their search preparation and hiring process.

  *
Grad Level Interviewing (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/hsmjaz)
| September 16, 12PM-1PM ET, Wasserman USQ, Presentation Room B

    * Attend this workshop to assist you in identifying and leveraging skills acquired in graduate school and develop a strong professional story to bolster your interviewing skills.

  *
Job Searching for International Students (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/xknjaz)
| September 16, 2PM-3:30PM ET, Virtual

    * Are you an international student seeking an internship or full-time employment in the United States? Participate in this workshop to learn about valuable strategies for navigating the U.S. internship and job search. Topics include search resources for F-1 students, networking, the application process in the U.S., and considerations for CPT and OPT.



@NYU University Life (CMEP/LGBTQ+ Center)

  *
CMEP Around the City: Wing on Wo & Co. (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/ddojaz)
| September 9, 3-5PM ET

    * Join the Center for Multicultural Education and Programs to visit the oldest shop in Chinatown, Wing on Wo & Co., and learn about how the owners support community-based initiatives and reinterpret tradition through an Asian American lens.

  *
Apply to First Year Queers & Allies (FYQA) (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/t5ojaz)
| Deadline: September 10, 12PM ET

    * MindfulNYU hosts a wide offering of
FREE yoga and meditation classes (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/9xpjaz)
throughout the week during the academic year. All classes are open to students, faculty, and staff with a current and valid NYU ID.

  *
Quench: Spill the Tea with Teagan (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/pqqjaz)
| September 10, 12:30-2PM ET, Kimmel 602

    * Quench is the LGBTQ+ Center's monthly free lunch series connecting students to NYU and NYC resources. For the first Quench of the year, come meet Teagan Rabuano, the new Director of the LGBTQ+ Center! This is a space for all members of the NYU community to ask questions, share feedback, and discuss the Center's upcoming priorities and initiatives. Whether you're curious about what's ahead or have ideas of your own, we want to hear from you. Tea (of course!) and lunch will be provided.

  *
First-Generation Student Mixer (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/5irjaz)
| September 10, 4-6PM ET, Kimmel 804/5

    * Learn about how you can get involved and thrive as a first-gen student at NYU and mingle with one another. Connect with student-led organizations like the First-Generation Low-Income Partnership (FLIP), meet the team from Proud to Be First, and learn about the FOCUS mentorship program.

  *
Grad Social: Stonewall Reception (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/lbsjaz)
| September 11, 6-8PM ET, Stonewall Inn

    * Are you a grad student who wants to meet and create community with fellow grad students? Join the LGBTQ+ Center at the historic Stonewall Inn for an evening of music, drinks, and new friendships. You must be 21 or older AND have a valid photo ID to attend. Light snacks will be provided and beverages can be purchased on your own.

  *
Year 2 @ NYU Launch Party (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/13sjaz)
| September 12, 2-5PM ET, Kimmel, Rosenthal Pavilion

    * So it's your second year at NYU, now what? Come to the Year 2 Launch Party to celebrate, connect, recharge, and map your path forward. Meet your NYU support network, who will help you plan for everything from budgeting to internships while you enjoy music, free food, games, and giveaways. Are you ready to make the most of this year at NYU and in NYC?

  *
Become a 2025-2026 FOCUS Mentee! (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/hwtjaz)
| Deadline: September 28 11:59PM ET

    * FOCUS Mentorship Program connects first and second-year, first-generation students with NYU alum, faculty, staff, and graduate mentors. Through FOCUS, mentees gain confidence, explore passions, and build community at NYU.

  *
Love Wins Food Pantry NYC (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/xoujaz)

    * Love Wins NYC is a queer-centric and volunteer-led effort to address food insecurity in NYC. Love Wins distributes fresh and free produce to New Yorkers in locations across the city every month. They are always looking for donations and volunteers to help promote food justice, particularly for the LGBTQ+ immigrant community.



@NYU Global Spiritual Life

  * Walking Meditation to Pier 45 with MindfulNYU | September 15, 10-11:15AM

    * Begin your week with connection and join our walking meditation! We will meet outside the GCASL building and begin our contemplative walk to Pier 45. Walking together, we will be invited into a combination of mindfulness practices that foster connection, curiosity, and community. No experience required--just bring comfortable shoes and an open heart. If you have any questions, please reach out to mindfulness@nyu.edu.

  * MindfulNYU Classes

    * MindfulNYU hosts a wide offering of
FREE yoga and meditation classes (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/dhvjaz)
throughout the week during the academic year. All classes are open to students, faculty, and staff with a current and valid NYU ID.



@NYU Office of Global Services

  *
Passport Drive for US Citizens (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/t9vjaz)
| September 26, StudentLink

    * Apply for or renew your US passport! The NYU Office of Global Services is offering Passport Acceptance events in partnership with the New York Passport Agency. This aims to help NYU community members get their US travel document, especially students planning to study abroad in the near future.

  *
English Conversation & Culture (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/91wjaz)
| Every Wednesday, 4-5PM, Kimmel 704

    * This interactive and informative series will explore topics like American academic culture, idioms and slang, and professional English conversation. It's a welcoming safe space for everyone to learn and practice--no need for notebooks or laptops, just bring yourself!



@NYU Libraries

  *
Grad Student Open House at NYU Libraries (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/puxjaz)
| September 9, 6-7PM ET, Bobst Second Floor North Reading Room

    * Welcome to the Libraries! Drop in during our Open House with subject liaisons and other library specialists to learn about the variety of resources available as you launch your graduate journey at NYU. Light refreshments and scheduled raffle giveaways will be provided. Hosted by NYU Libraries and Grad Life.

  *
Finding Non-English Language Materials at NYU and Beyond (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/5myjaz)
| September 10, 12-1PM ET, Bobst 619

    * NYU Libraries collects materials in more than 20 languages in addition to English, but finding them can be tricky. This class will give you tips on how to unearth these as well as the other non-English resources available to you beyond NYU Libraries.

  *
Literature Reviews in the Sciences (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/lfzjaz)
| September 11, 11AM-12:30PM ET, Virtual

    * A literature review is an integral part of research and writing in the sciences. A literature review can be standalone document or part of a larger article or thesis. They may be produced for a class assignment or something that you wish to publish. While some of the details may differ between specific disciplines, the overall approach has much in common across the natural and social sciences.

  *
Introduction to Machine Learning Clinic - A Project Walkthrough Session 1 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/17zjaz)
| September 11, 1-2PM ET, Dibner LC 433

    * Welcome to the Libraries! Drop in during our Open House with subject liaisons and other library specialists to learn about the variety of resources available as you launch your graduate journey at NYU. Light refreshments and scheduled raffle giveaways will be provided. Hosted by NYU Libraries and Grad Life.

  * Hack Dibner Information Session | September 12,
10-11AM ET (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/h00jaz)
and
2-3PM ET (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/xs1jaz), Dibner LC 433

    * Welcome to the Libraries! Drop in during our Open House with subject liaisons and other library specialists to learn about the variety of resources available as you launch your graduate journey at NYU. Light refreshments and scheduled raffle giveaways will be provided. Hosted by NYU Libraries and Grad Life.

  *
NYU Libraries Classes (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/dl2jaz)

    * Free courses ranging from Data Visualization with Tableau to Data Wrangling in R and Python for Harvesting Data on the Web to Writing a Data Management Plan for Grant Applications.



@NYU Writing Center

  *
Writing Workshops (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/td3jaz)

    * Need help with your writing? (We all do!) Need help organizing an essay? Want to make your sentences clearer and more concise? Unsure of where to start with articulating a research problem? This semester, the Expository Writing Program at NYU is offering a set of remote and in person writing / research workshops for all undergraduates and MAs.





###     END.


 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/lr4nqh/dt03qtsf/953jaz)

subject: CDS Career Events: Rockstar Games Panel and Datathon (plus some additional events / reminders)
body:
Hello!

A couple upcoming events with Rockstar Games! Please read this carefully.
You must register for *each* event. Registering for the Datathon does not
guarantee participation.

*Rockstar Games Panel - Thursday, October 9, 1:30pm - 2:30pm*
Are you curious about what it‚Äôs like to work in a data science role at the
game studio that has created and published some of the most popular and
critically acclaimed games in the world including series such as Grand
Theft Auto, Max Payne, Red Dead, and more? Hear from Data Scientists from
the NYC team as they answer career-related questions.

*Register Here:* https://RockstarGamesPanelFall2025.eventbrite.com


*Rockstar Games Datathon ‚Äì Thursday, October 9, 2:30pm ‚Äì 4:45pm*
Join representatives from Rockstar Games on NYU‚Äôs campus for an interactive
workshop that will give you the opportunity to solve a Rockstar specific
problem using a provided data set. Students will work in small groups and
receive mentorship and guidance from Rockstar‚Äôs data science team.

*Registration Opens for the Datathon on Tuesday, September 30 at 12:00pm*.

*Register Here:* https://RockstarDatathonFall2025.eventbrite.com
*Registration will close, at the latest, the day BEFORE the Datathon. You
cannot register day-of.*

*The priority deadline to RSVP for the Datathon event is Tuesday, October
7 at 10am* via the following link:
https://RockstarDatathonFall2025.eventbrite.com.
***You will then be contacted by me to provide additional information (via
a google form). *If you are selected, you will be contacted by Rockstar
Games directly.



*Additional Events (Reminders):*

*Company Information Session with EY - Tuesday, September 30 at 5:00pm (CDS
Open Space)*
We will be joined by representatives from EY to discuss career
opportunities, including some recent CDS graduates who started as interns
with EY.
*Open Roles:*

USA - Tax - Tax Technology and Transformation (TTT) - ALWIN - Intern -
Summer 2026 at EY
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__usearlycareers.ey.com_job_new-2Dyork_usa-2Dtax-2Dtax-2Dtechnology-2Dand-2Dtransformation-2Dttt-2Dalwin-2Dintern-2Dsummer-2D2026_39053_85914260864&d=DwMGaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=8n6fv_YG6liTwuk1zqPGuA&m=08VrCFUK3l3VeLZuQL_mASbCbj471wPqwORF8OOASWu-BbvZnQ38-Wp08VWRyqRm&s=fmTjYQD5eEvPDWP1-AgbyJzL1wwrbW15NBAqBfCh7hE&e=>

USA - Tax - Tax Technology and Transformation (TTT) - ALWIN - Staff at EY
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__usearlycareers.ey.com_job_new-2Dyork_usa-2Dtax-2Dtax-2Dtechnology-2Dand-2Dtransformation-2Dttt-2Dalwin-2Dstaff_39053_85914261504&d=DwMGaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=8n6fv_YG6liTwuk1zqPGuA&m=08VrCFUK3l3VeLZuQL_mASbCbj471wPqwORF8OOASWu-BbvZnQ38-Wp08VWRyqRm&s=H2CztYp1t8XUXo7tIGqKAtqRO9t5mK1cIKNVB8RFyFg&e=>

*RSVP Here:* Register Here
<https://www.eventbrite.com/e/company-info-session-ey-tickets-1734324193349?aff=oddtdtcreator>
 (Please use your NYU email address)


*Company Information Session with Flite - Thursday, October 2 at 5:00pm
(CDS Open Space)*
We will be joined by Flite Co-founder and CEO Suvir Wadhwa to discuss
career opportunities with his company. Suvir is a CDS alumni and success
story!

*RSVP Here: *Register Here
<https://www.eventbrite.com/e/company-info-session-flite-tickets-1734779856249?aff=oddtdtcreator>*
(Please
use your NYU email address)*


*MS Admission Ambassadors x NYC Tech Interview
Squad - Friday, October 3 at 4:30pm (CDS Open Space)*

We‚Äôre excited to invite you to a special in-person event hosted by the MS
Admissions Ambassadors at the NYU Center for Data Science, featuring the
NYC Tech Interview Squad ‚Äì a group of data scientists and engineers
dedicated to helping students navigate the job market by sharing insider
hiring insights from ‚Äúthe other side of the table.‚Äù

*RSVP Here:* https://cdsfall2025nyctechinterviewsquad.eventbrite.com


Networking Reception: Connecting with International Alumni
<https://nyu.joinhandshake.com/edu/events/1758622> - October 7 at 5:30pm
(Wasserman Center USQ Pres Room A)

Networking is key to having a successful career. Professional connections
can be made in a variety of settings including work, conference and
professional receptions. Join the Office of Global Services, the Wasserman
Center for Career Development and your fellow international students for an
interactive and informative experience to learn how to conduct yourself
professionally and expand your connections. Dress for the event is business
casual. Appetizers will be served. This event is open only to NYU
International Students.


Register for Networking Reception: Connecting with International Alumni
<https://nyu.joinhandshake.com/edu/events/1758622>.



*NYU Careers in STEM Fair - October 8, 2025,  12:00 PM - 4:00 PM EDT (NYU
Brooklyn Athletic Facility (6 MetroTech Center, Brooklyn, NY 11201))*

Wasserman is hosting, in partnership with the NYU Tandon School of
Engineering the NYU Careers in STEM Fair. This event is designed for
companies recruiting undergraduate and graduate students specializing in
engineering, technology, computer science, data science, and other related
majors. All companies hiring for jobs and internships in STEM
concentrations are welcome.

*RSVP Here:* Register on Handshake
<https://app.joinhandshake.com/career_fairs/952bf352-cdcf-481a-a750-a738b6644077/employer_preview>
.


Best,
Zo√´

-- 
Zo√´ Levin, MA (she/her)
Assistant Director of Career Development and Industry Partnerships
NYU Center for Data Science
60 Fifth Avenue
New York, NY 10011
212-998-3313
