CDS Career Events: Point72 Site Visit added! Lots of events next week!
body:
*Registration Opens TOMORROW:*

Point72 Info Session and Site Visit - October 2, 3:00pm

Point72 Asset Management is a global firm led by Steven Cohen that invests
in multiple asset classes and strategies worldwide. Resting on more than a
quarter-century of investing experience, we seek to be the industry‚Äôs
premier asset manager through delivering superior risk-adjusted returns,
adhering to the highest ethical standards, and offering the greatest
opportunities to the industry‚Äôs brightest talent. Join CDS and Point72 for
a company info session at their offices in Hudson Yards!

*Note: This event is limited to 25 spots and only open to FIRST YEAR MS
Students. *


*RSVP Opens Friday, September 26 at 2:00pm*. *The first 25 registrations
will receive confirmation. The remainder will be on a waitlist and will be
contacted in the order you registered if spots open up.*


*RSVP Here:* https://point72sitevisitfall2025.eventbrite.com

subject: CDS Grad Career Fair - Next Thursday!
body:
Hello!

As a reminder, next week is the CDS Grad Career Fair on Thursday, September
25 at 1:30pm.

This in-person fair is a great opportunity to speak with representatives
from a few different employers hiring for Data Science related roles. *This
event is for graduate CDS students only.*

Our Fall 2025 Career Fair will have representatives from: House IQ,
DoorDash, Arcsine Analytics, S&P Global, MTA, BNP Paribas, StackAI, and
JPMorgan.

*Info on each employer in terms of sponsorship, role type, and links to
open positions can be found here
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1F1FYAHI1F9eBx3uQAy0a5NZs9fVh9OcAwdgw8SIbo6U/edit?usp=sharing>
(login to your NYU email to access).*
*RSVP Here (if you haven't already):*
https://Fall2025CDSCareerFair.eventbrite.com
<https://fall2025cdscareerfair.eventbrite.com/>

Best,
Zo√´

-- 
Zo√´ Levin, MA (she/her)
Assistant Director of Career Development and Industry Partnerships
NYU Center for Data Science
60 Fifth Avenue
New York, NY 10011
212-998-3313
Website: cds.nyu.edu
Book an appointment here <https://calendar.app.google/1rNEhQzgzdxJiC7x5>

subject: Fwd: Job Opportunity for Master in Data Science Students and Recent Graduates
Fall 2025/January 2026 Graduation Application: Deadline - October 15, 2025
body:
Dear Students,

If you are planning to graduate after the Fall 2025 semester, you can apply
for Fall 2025/January 2026 graduation. The deadline to apply is October 15,
2025.

For information on how to apply for graduation, visit:
https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/registration-records-and-graduation/graduation-and-diplomas/graduation-information.html

Please reach out if you have any questions.

Best,
Francheska

-- 
Francheska Jimenez, M.A.
Assistant Director of Academic & Student Affairs
Center for Data Science
E: fj6@nyu.edu
T: 212-998-3358
60 Fifth Ave., 7th floor
New York, NY 10011

My office is a *S**A**FE ZONE* for individuals of all ethnicities,
abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and gender identities.
*gender pronouns
<https://www.nyu.edu/life/global-inclusion-and-diversity/learning-and-development/toolkits/pronouns.html>:
she, her, hers*

subject: [Important] Fall 2025 Add/Drop Deadline & Waitlists
body:
Hello:

*Please note that the Fall 2025 add/drop deadline
<https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/registration-records-and-graduation/academic-calendar.html>
for students is this Monday, September 15.* Tuition and fees for individual
classes dropped on or before this date will be refunded 100% for students
who remain enrolled in at least one class. For term and/or total withdrawal
refund information, refer to the Refund Schedule for Complete Withdrawal on
the Bursar‚Äôs website
<https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/bills-payments-and-refunds/refunds-and-withdrawals/dropping-classes.html>.
Withdrawing from classes on or after September 16 will also result in a ‚ÄúW‚Äù
grade on the student transcript.

Students will also no longer be enrolled into a class from a waitlist and
waitlists are purged after September 15.

That said, there is typically a lot of movement on the waitlists as we near
the add/drop deadline as students are finalizing their schedules. *If you
no longer wish to enroll in your waitlisted course, please drop
<https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/registration-records-and-graduation/albert-help/training/students/registration/drop.html>
from the waitlist now.* If the system automatically enrolls you into your
waitlisted course overnight on September 15th, you will not have the
ability to drop the course on September 16th. You will have to withdraw
from the course and thus *tuition/fees will not be refunded and there will
be a W for the course on your transcript.*

Best,
Tina

Tina Lam (*she/her/hers*)
Assistant Director of Graduate Programs
Center for Data Science, New York University
cds.nyu.edu | book an appointment
<https://calendar.app.google/B8BNBb4PjoEEEsTT7>

subject: [Important] Fall 2025: Important Dates, Reminders, and Resources
body:
Hello:

I hope that the start of your semester is going well! This email is long,
but please read as it includes reminders of important registration and
graduation dates as well as other information that may be of interest to
you.

As a reminder, students are required to be continuously enrolled each
academic semester (Fall and Spring). If you are not enrolling in any
courses this semester, please reach out ASAP to discuss as this is only
possible with an approved leave of absence or maintenance of matriculation.
Deadline to submit a Fall 2025 leave of absence request is September 15th
and this must be discussed with the Program before then.

*Important Dates* (NYU Academic Calendar
<https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/registration-records-and-graduation/academic-calendar.html?semester=Fall%202025>
)

   - *Wednesday, September 10*: CDS deadline for new Fall 2025 MSDS
   students to waive DS-GA 1002 Probability and Statistics. Instructions to
   waive the course is in the CDS Registration Guide
   <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ieh-2pg6PgN-eRFG4oPH2HZf4jxv47oV1BBvt7rzeMY/edit?usp=sharing>.
   If a request is not submitted at this time, students must complete the
   course to fulfill the degree requirements (no late waivers will be given).
   - *Monday, September 15*: Fall 2025 Add/Drop Deadline - Any course
   dropped after this date will show up on your transcript with a "W.
      - Last day to add/drop courses
      - Last day of wait lists
      - Last day to drop course and receive 100% refund
      - Last day to drop course and not receive a "W" (withdrawal) on
      transcript
   - *Monday, October 13*: Fall Break - no classes
   - *Tuesday, October 14*: Legislative Monday - Classes meet according to
   a Monday schedule. There will be no Tuesday classes this week.
   - *Wednesday, October 15*: Last day to submit graduation application for
   Fall 2025 / January 2026 graduation
      - Visit
      https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/registration-records-and-graduation/graduation-and-diplomas/graduation-information.html
      for information on how to apply for graduation.
      - For PhD graduation applicants, please review the
      dissertation/graduation submission timeline and deadlines for
January 2026
      graduation -
      https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qaqdPbH9wonRKWDW1RGjEPYSGPD2CPwpt7I0W3nEhBI/edit?usp=sharing
   - *Wednesday, November 19*: Last day to submit pass/fail requests to
   CDS.
      - As a reminder, *MSDS* students can only take 1 elective (this does
      not include your required "Data Science Elective") and DS-GA
1009 Practical
      Training for Data Science as pass/fail for your MSDS. Required
courses (and
      substitutes) must be taken for a letter grade. Students in the Industry
      Concentration can use their 1 elective allowance for an Industry
      Concentration elective.
      - *PhD* students cannot take courses except for DS-GA 2001 (which is
      already set to pass/fail) as P/F.
      - Once you complete and sign the form
      <https://gsas.nyu.edu/content/dam/nyu-as/gsas/documents/policies-and-procedures-and-forms/writeable-pass-fail-form.pdf>
      (do not worry about the Director of Graduate Studies signature), please
      send the form and a copy of your transcript to Francheska Jimenez (
      fj6@nyu.edu) by *Wednesday, November 19*. She will take care of the
      Director of Graduate Studies signature and submit it to GSAS. Instructor
      signatures are no longer required. This gives Francheska time to meet the
      school deadline of Monday, November 24th.
   - *Monday, November 24*: Last day for students to submit a request to
   (a) withdraw from any or all Fall class(es) and (b) totally withdraw from
   the University for Fall. If this is something you would like to do, please
   reach out to Kathryn Angeles (kangeles@nyu.edu) first before submitting
   a form so that we can talk about the rules and procedures.
   - *Wednesday, November 26*: Legislative Friday - Classes meet according
   to a Friday schedule. There will be no Wednesday classes this week.
   - *Thursday, November 27 - Friday, November 28*: Thanksgiving Recess -
   no classes
   - *Thursday, December 11*: Last Day of Fall 2025 Classes
   - *December 15 - December 19*: Official NYU Final Exam Period

*International Students and Part-Time *
If you are an international student and Fall 2025 is your last semester and
you need less than 9 credits to complete the 36-credit degree, you can
enroll part-time (less than 9 credits). However, you must get approval from
OGS. More information can be found at
https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/student-visa-and-immigration/current-students/visa-and-academic-changes/register-part-time.html
.

*Fall 2025 Graduates and Post-Completion OPT*
https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/student-visa-and-immigration/current-students/employment-and-tax/optional-practical-training/PostCompletionOPT.html
MS students applying for OPT, please put Francheska's information as your
advisor contact: fj6@nyu.edu.
PhD students applying for OPT, please consult Kathryn before applying:
kangeles@nyu.edu.

*Resources*

   - *Wellness Services*: Counseling and Wellness Services (CWS) can help
   with any mental health concerns you might experience, including stress,
   anxiety, alcohol or drugs, eating, depression, family issues, suicidal
   thoughts, and more. They offer individual counseling, group counseling,
   wellness workshops, referrals to long-term services in the community, and
   long-term psychiatric medication services on-site. The Wellness Workshops
   help students develop new skills that enhance personal, academic and social
   well-being. Except for psychiatry services, all counseling services are
   provided at no cost. See here for more information on these services and
   how to call, chat, or make an appointment with a counselor:
   https://www.nyu.edu/students/wellbeing/clinical-services/counseling-services.html
   - *CDS Student Handbooks*
      - *MS*:
      https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pgDKSQeEEZq58kugHDaF_fhMsQ6Qm-myRLXKgwAB6vo/edit?usp=sharing
      - *PhD*:
      https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QWW0bk33ck7hqenN3JGY8_fBbn4KSncFl60T-UqFGos/edit?usp=sharing
   - *MSDS Slack*: We will share information, resources, etc. that are
   relevant for current MSDS students on this platform. Join at
   https://msdscurrent.slack.com/join/shared_invite/zt-9rhhuhv9-Ez_T_ihRwVts6gmpQGXkWA#/shared-invite/email.
   It is also another way for you to communicate with and share information
   with other MSDS students.

If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out.

Best,
CDS Staff

subject: Re: [MSDS Inquiry] Re: Advice on DS-GA 1009 - Practical Training for Data Science
body:
Hi Abhinav,

Please disregard my previous email.

I have updated your record to remove the Industry Concentration and added
the general Data Science Track. Professor Brian McFee (brian.mcfee@nyu.edu)
is now your faculty advisor.

You can review the track requirements on our website:
https://cds.nyu.edu/masters-tracks/ or in the CDS MS Student Handbook
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pgDKSQeEEZq58kugHDaF_fhMsQ6Qm-myRLXKgwAB6vo/edit?usp=sharing>.
Let me know if you have any questions.

Best,
Francheska

A few updates to the Fall 2025 Registration Guide
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ieh-2pg6PgN-eRFG4oPH2HZf4jxv47oV1BBvt7rzeMY/edit?tab=t.0>
:

   - DS-GA 3001.011/.012 *Topics: Bayesian Machine Learning* is fully set
   up in Albert. Please enroll/waitlist directly in Albert if you meet the
   prerequisites and are interested. No permission from cds-masters@nyu.edu
   needed.
   - New topics course open for enrollment - DS-GA 3001.009/010 *Topics:
   Information Theory for Statistics and Learning*. Prerequisite
   information, course description, and draft syllabus are in the Registration
   Guide.
   - Fall 2025 cross-registration information for FRE-GY and MATH-GA
   courses updated in the Registration Guide.

Best,
Tina

Tina Lam (*she/her/hers*)
Assistant Director of Graduate Programs
Center for Data Science, New York University
cds.nyu.edu

subject: Re: Fall 2025 CDS Graduate Student Registration Guide
body:
Hello:

A few updates about Fall 2025 course offerings:

   - Mathematical Statistics (DS-GA 1020) is *cancelled* and will not be
   offered in Fall 2025.
   - New topics course added - DS-GA 3001.011/.012 Special Topics in Data
   Science: Bayesian Machine Learning. This course is sponsored by Courant CS.
   We have 5 seats; 2 of the seats are reserved for PhD students. We are
   waiting for the Registrar to set up the course restrictions and reserve
   seats. For now, the course *requires permission to enroll*. Please email
   cds-masters@nyu.edu *AFTER* your enrollment appointment begins for
   permission to enroll. We will review requests in order of email receipt.
   Note the prerequisites and other course information in the Registration
   Guide
   <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ieh-2pg6PgN-eRFG4oPH2HZf4jxv47oV1BBvt7rzeMY/edit?tab=t.0>.

   - We are working on adding an advanced topics course to Fall 2025; more
   information will be shared in the guide and via email once available.

Best,
Tina

Tina Lam (*she/her/hers*)
Assistant Director of Graduate Programs
Center for Data Science, New York University
cds.nyu.edu

subject: Fall 2025 CDS Graduate Student Registration Guide
body:
Hello:

The *Fall 2025 registration guide* can be found here:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ieh-2pg6PgN-eRFG4oPH2HZf4jxv47oV1BBvt7rzeMY/edit?tab=t.0

*Please read through this entire document. You will need to use your NYU
email to access this document.* There are registration instructions, course
information, and cross-registration information for several departments
included in the document. The guide will be updated as we receive more
information - we will also email any major changes or additions.

Registration for Fall 2025 begins on Monday, April 21 for MS students. Please
check when your *exact day and time* to register is by going to the *Enrollment
Dates * section of Albert <http://albert.nyu.edu/albert_index.html>.

Similar to previous semesters, we have seats reserved for PhD students in
several of our classes - details are in the guide for the courses this
applies to. Therefore a course may appear open on Albert, but is actually
closed for MS students and has a waitlist. Be sure to review the
Registration Overview at the beginning of the guide
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/15Ykj-po6QugK_Av5nxYDVzwvRL3UvosycF6y3yQN3e8/edit?usp=sharing>
for more information and best practices.

If you have any questions about the schedule or find any discrepancies
on Albert
Course Search <http://albert.nyu.edu/albert_index.html>, please reach out
to us at cds-masters@nyu.edu.

Best,
Tina

Tina Lam (*she/her/hers*)
Assistant Director of Graduate Programs
Center for Data Science, New York University
cds.nyu.edu

subject: Reminders: Important Upcoming Dates
body:
Hello:

A few reminders:

If you plan to graduate after the Spring 2025 semester, please apply for *May
2025 graduation*. The deadline to apply is this *Saturday, February 15,
2025*.
For information on how to apply for graduation, visit:
https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/registration-records-and-
graduation/graduation-and-diplomas/graduation-information.html.

If you are an *international student* and would like to request
*post-completion
OPT*, please put down my information (tina.lam@nyu.edu) for your advisor
contact on the OGS application form. Do not list your faculty advisor. Your
completion date for the application is May 14, 2025 - the last day of the
final exam period.
More information on the process here:
https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/student-visa-and-immigration/current-students/employment-and-tax/optional-practical-training/PostCompletionOPT.html

*Upcoming Dates to Note*:
*Monday, February 17: President's Day* - no classes & university offices
are closed
*Tuesday, February 18: Legislative Monday* - Classes meet according to a
Monday schedule.

Please reach out if you have any questions.

Best,
Tina

Tina Lam (*she/her/hers*)
Assistant Director of Graduate Programs
Center for Data Science, New York University
cds.nyu.edu

>       from a waitlist and waitlist are purged
>       -
>
>       Last day to drop course and receive 100% refund
>       -
>
>       Any course dropped after this date will show up on your transcript
>       with a "W."
>       -
>
>    Saturday, February 15: Last day to Apply for Spring 2025 Graduation
>    -
>
>       Visit
>       https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/registration-records-and-graduation/graduation-and-diplomas/graduation-information.html
>       for information on how to apply for graduation.
>       -
>
>       For PhD graduation applicants, here is a link to the
>       dissertation/graduation submission timeline and deadlines for May 2025
>       graduation -
>       https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v5090tx24aj9772VTaiNbuOJUxk9PuCxbtPiMTjfq1s/edit?gid=0#gid=0
>
>       -
>
>    Monday, February 17: President's Day - no classes & university offices
>    are closed
>    -
>
>    Tuesday, February 18: Legislative Monday - Classes meet according to a
>    Monday schedule.
>    -
>
>    Monday, March 24 - Friday, March 28: Spring Break - no classes
>    -
>
>    Monday, April 14: Last day to submit pass/fail requests to CDS.
>    -
>
>       As a reminder, MSDS students can only take 1 elective (this does
>       not include your required "Data Science Elective") and DS-GA 1009 Practical
>       Training for Data Science as pass/fail for your MSDS. Required courses (and
>       substitutes) must be taken for a letter grade. Students in the Industry
>       Concentration can use their 1 elective allowance for an Industry
>       Concentration elective.
>       -
>
>       PhD students cannot take courses except for DS-GA 2001 (which is
>       already set to pass/fail) as P/F.
>       -
>
>       Once you complete and sign the form
>       <https://gsas.nyu.edu/content/dam/nyu-as/gsas/documents/policies-and-procedures-and-forms/writeable_pass_fail_form.pdf>
>       (do not worry about the Director of Graduate Studies signature), please
>       send the form and a copy of your transcript to Francheska Jimenez (
>       fj6@nyu.edu) by Monday, April 14. Francheska will take care of the
>       Director of Graduate Studies signature and submit it to GSAS. Instructor
>       signatures are no longer required. This gives Francheska time to meet the
>       school deadline of Thursday, April 17.
>       -
>
>    Thursday, April 17: Last day for students to submit a term withdrawal
>    request or to submit a request to withdraw from a Spring course. If this is
>    something you would like to do, please reach out to the appropriate contact
>    (below) first before submitting a form so that we can talk about the rules
>    and procedures.
>    -
>
>       MS / non-degree students - Tina Lam (tina.lam@nyu.edu)
>       -
>
>       PhD - cds-phd@nyu.edu
>       -
>
>    Tuesday, May 6: Last Day of Spring Classes
>    -
>
>    Thursday, May 8 - Wednesday, May 14: Final Exam Period
>    -
>
>    Thursday, May 8, 11am: GSAS Doctoral Convocation
>    <https://gsas.nyu.edu/student-life/convocation.html>
>    -
>
>    Monday, May 12, 4pm: GSAS Master's Convocation
>    <https://gsas.nyu.edu/student-life/convocation.html>
>    -
>
>    Thursday, May 15: Commencement
>    <https://www.nyu.edu/life/events-traditions/commencement.html>
>
> As a reminder, students are required to be continuously enrolled each
> academic semester (Fall and Spring). If you are planning not to take
> courses this semester, please reach out ASAP to discuss as this is only
> possible with an approved leave of absence or maintenance of matriculation.
>
> International Students and Part-Time
>
> If you are an international student and Spring 2025 is your last semester,
> you are able to be part-time (less than 9 credits), but must get approval
> from OGS. More information can be found at
> https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/student-visa-and-immigration/current-students/visa-and-academic-changes/register-part-time.html.
> Please put down Tina's information as your advisor contact:
> tina.lam@nyu.edu
>
> May 2025 Graduates and Post-Completion OPT
>
> MS students applying for OPT
> <https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/student-visa-and-immigration/current-students/employment-and-tax/optional-practical-training/PostCompletionOPT.html>,
> please put Tina's information as your advisor contact: tina.lam@nyu.edu.
>
> PhD students applying for OPT
> <https://www.nyu.edu/students/student-information-and-resources/student-visa-and-immigration/current-students/employment-and-tax/optional-practical-training/PostCompletionOPT.html>,
> please consult Kathryn before applying: kangeles@nyu.edu.
>
> Resources
>
>    -
>
>    Wellness Services: Counseling and Wellness Services (CWS) can help
>    with any mental health concerns you might experience, including stress,
>    anxiety, alcohol or drugs, eating, depression, family issues, suicidal
>    thoughts, and more. They offer individual counseling, group counseling,
>    wellness workshops, referrals to long-term services in the community, and
>    long-term psychiatric medication services on-site. The Wellness
>    Workshops
>    <https://www.nyu.edu/students/health-and-wellness/services/counseling-services/wellness-workshops.html>
>    help students develop new skills that enhance personal, academic and social
>    well-being. Except for psychiatry services, all counseling services are
>    provided at no cost. See here
>    <https://www.nyu.edu/students/health-and-wellness/services/counseling-services.html>
>    for more information on how to call, chat, or make an appointment with a
>    counselor.
>    -
>
>    CDS Student Handbooks
>    -
>
>       MS:
>       https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pgDKSQeEEZq58kugHDaF_fhMsQ6Qm-myRLXKgwAB6vo/edit?usp=sharing
>       -
>
>       PhD:
>       https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QWW0bk33ck7hqenN3JGY8_fBbn4KSncFl60T-UqFGos/edit?usp=sharing
>       -
>
>    CDS Graduate Student Portal:
>    https://sites.google.com/nyu.edu/cdsgradportal/ (NYU login required)
>    -
>
>       The central hub for all CDS student resources and guides. Here you
>       will find information about academic advising, career and professional
>       development resources, NYU and external resources, and more.
>       -
>
>    MSDS Slack: We will share information, resources, etc. that are
>    relevant for current MSDS students on this platform. Join at
>    https://msdscurrent.slack.com. It is also another way for you to
>    communicate with and share information with other MSDS students.
>    -
>
>    Printing, Scanning, and Copying at CDS (60 Fifth Avenue): please see
>    attached guide for more information
>
> If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out.
>
> Best,
>
> Tina
>
> Tina Lam (she/her/hers)
>
> Assistant Director of Graduate Programs
>
> Center for Data Science, New York University
>
> cds.nyu.edu
>
>

subject: Re: Summer 2025 DS-GA Course Offerings
body:
Hello,

I'm writing to share some recent updates regarding *Summer 2025 course
offerings*:

   - DS-GA 1009 Practical Training for Data Science (internship / CPT
   course) - see course guidelines
   <https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vRYqfCX-46TRpnr4a8E2iCZkjvY4AseiX24mCYsYk70tYngb0MEubsei7_r3_9h2RLx7VxZH9q3UtNI/pub>
      - The course advisor should be available in early March to review
      submissions.
      - DS-GA 1010 Independent Study in Data Science - see course guidelines
   <https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vQwdxOB86vfVBdr3m4z2Cjl9WWpWtcvLoiErxbsUVvfQ17F0bsozG-0DmzkiOmDByijOE1rgSnmmaE6/pub>
   - DS-GA 1170 Fundamental Algorithms
      - This course is online for Summer 2025.
      - DS-GA 2433 Database Systems

Cross-registration form for Summer 2025 CSCI-GA courses:
https://forms.gle/qJh4df6XDUoNmkaZ8
If the course is not pre-approved
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vSU45k7_tEHzS6TVc03S2WUYt-xOmW3DJI6y1J6NAkICimpv9hbfFO0t-i3xI_mdA7s37goZRPOZc8O/pubhtml>,
please be sure to submit the MSDS elective request form
<https://forms.gle/AreyEE4c2ccdFGKD9> for the course.

Let us know if you have any questions.

Best,
Tina

Tina Lam (*she/her/hers*)
Assistant Director of Graduate Programs
Center for Data Science, New York University
cds.nyu.edu

Free Flu Shots (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dmqqgj/l8cl7xmh/9qv2bt)

Flu season is here! The Student Health Center offers free flu shots to all NYU students, regardless of your insurance. Getting vaccinated can help prevent you from getting the flu, stop you from spreading it to others, and make your illness milder if you do get sick‚Äîso make sure to take advantage of this opportunity!

 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dmqqgj/l8cl7xmh/pjw2bt)

NYU Group Commute Pilot Program (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dmqqgj/l8cl7xmh/5bx2bt)

Group commuting provides meetup times and locations along a route for cyclists and micromobility users to ride together. Whether you are a new rider building confidence or a seasoned commuter looking for company, fill out this interest form by Friday, September 26, to shape a pilot program this fall!

subject: üöÄ Learn. Test. Launch. Your startup journey begins at NYU
body:
NYU founders get funding, mentorship, & more ‚Äî join them


To view this email online, paste this link into your browser:
https://t.e2ma.net/message/wb2n8o/c0zibuce





Hey NYU Innovator,

Have you been thinking about launching a startup or scaling your current project?

This is your chance. The¬†NYU Startup Accelerator Program (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/wzotibc)¬†is accepting applications ‚Äî and it‚Äôs made for students like you who want to take their idea, prototype, or social venture to the next level.

 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/csptibc)

What is the Startup Accelerator Program?

NYU‚Äôs three-part accelerator is structured to meet founders wherever you are in your journey ‚Äî and help you move forward.

Stage 1 -¬†Startup Bootcamps (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/skqtibc):

For teams (at least one NYU member, preferably more) with an idea or prototype

A 3.5-hour session to dive into customer development: test assumptions, learn from real potential users

Pinpoint your real ‚Äúhair-on-fire‚Äù problem

Stage 2 - Startup Sprints (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/8crtibc):¬†

For teams with early prototypes or products

A 2-week intensive focused on business models & customer discovery

Perks include $1,000 in grants, access to VC & legal office hours, and Google Cloud credits

Stage 3 - Summer Launchpad (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/o5rtibc):

For ventures seeking growth to go to market. Priority given to those who participated in the Bootcamp & Sprint

9 weeks of mentorship, coaching, and pitch opportunities

Includes $16,500 in non-dilutive funding, pro bono legal/incorporation help, free banking accounting & tax advice, investor demo day (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/4xstibc), & more

What to Do Next:

1. RSVP for an upcoming How to Start a Startup session

These info sessions are a great entry point to learn how NYU helps founders ‚Äîeverything from idea stage through funding. Register below!

Wed, Sept. 17, 4:00‚Äì5:00PM ET (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/kqttibc)

Thu, Sept. 25, 4:00‚Äì5:00PM ET (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/0iutibc)

Mon, Sept. 29, 5:00‚Äì6:00PM ET (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/gbvtibc)

2.¬†Apply for the Startup Bootcamp (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/w3vtibc).¬†Deadlines are coming up ‚Äî don‚Äôt wait!

3. Book a coaching appointment (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/cwwtibc)¬†with a Founder-in-Residence or team member from the NYU Entrepreneurial Institute to talk through your startup idea.

All current NYU students, faculty, and staff are welcome to apply (alongside their co-founders), from any global NYU site.

Looking to join a team or add a collaborator before applying? Join us at Team Hunts on 9/18 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/soxtibc) and 10/20 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/8gytibc)¬†to share your valuable skills or¬†introduce your startup.

 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/wb2n8o/c0zibuce/o9ytibc)

Got questions? We want to hear from you! Send us an email at entrepreneur@nyu.edu¬†

subject: Explore the Power of Groundbreaking Research at the NYU Technology Venture Summit on April 18
body:
Explore the commercial potential of scientific research at NYU!


To view this email online, paste this link into your browser:
https://t.e2ma.net/message/cs9wuo/c0zibuce





NYU Technology Venture Summit (https://t.e2ma.net/click/cs9wuo/c0zibuce/katy99b)

Friday, April 18 | 9:00AM-2:00PM ET

NYU Kimmel Center, Rosenthal Pavilion

Join us for the 2025 NYU Technology Venture Summit, a premier gathering of NYU‚Äôs leading faculty and researchers who are unlocking the full market potential of their groundbreaking innovations.

This dynamic event showcases the cutting-edge ventures emerging from NYU‚Äôs research ecosystem, offering an opportunity to learn about the latest technologies and network with founders and investors who are dedicated to translating these discoveries into high-impact applications.

This year's Summit will feature:

Keynote Fireside Chat: With¬†Wayne Mackey, PhD (GSAS  (https://t.e2ma.net/click/cs9wuo/c0zibuce/02ty99b),¬†founder & CEO of Statespace (Aimlabs) (https://t.e2ma.net/click/cs9wuo/c0zibuce/gvuy99b)

Leveraging Your Scientific/Clinical Expertise to Solve Unmet Needs for Societal Impact Panel:¬†Featuring NYU scientific founders who have utilized University resources and grant funding to scale their research to market

NYU Demo Day Pitch Competition:¬†Watch the 2024-2025¬†NYU Technology Venture Accelerator (https://t.e2ma.net/click/cs9wuo/c0zibuce/wnvy99b) teams pitch to VC investors

Cocktail Reception & Poster Session:¬†Featuring over 25 faculty-led projects and ventures

subject: üìÖüìç Inspiration & Community: Free Tickets to the NYU Female Founders Forum!
body:
Support building a more equitable startup ecosystem.


To view this email online, paste this link into your browser:
https://t.e2ma.net/message/ssc4ro/c0zibuce





 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/8svn19b)

An Afternoon at NYU Celebrating The Power of Community

Join hundreds of entrepreneurs, investors, and startup enthusiasts at the 6th Annual NYU Female Founders Forum (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/olwn19b)¬†on Friday, Feb. 21!

The Forum offers inspiration, conversation, and networking in pursuit of building a more equitable startup ecosystem. This year's guest keynote speaker is¬†Lia Winograd (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/4dxn19b) (Stern MBA '19), co-founder & co-CEO of¬†Pepper (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/k6xn19b), the intimate apparel brand that‚Äôs redefining industry beauty standards.

Lia is a¬†Forbes 30 Under 30 and Inc. Magazine Top 100 Female Founders honoree. Originally from Colombia, she built and expanded Pepper‚Äôs production operations, which are based in her home country. Before founding Pepper, Lia honed her strategic skills at top consulting firm McKinsey & Company.

We'll also be joined by panelists from:¬†Betaworks (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/0yyn19b), Stepwise (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/grzn19b),¬†Alpha Partners (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/wj0n19b),¬†Comcast Ventures (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/cc1n19b),¬†Bloomberg¬†Beta (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/s41n19b),¬†CaroRhythm (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/8w2n19b),¬†Frich (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/op3n19b), Jivika (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/4h4n19b), the¬†Berkley Center for Entrepreneurship (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/ka5n19b), and the¬†NYU Innovation Venture Fund (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/025n19b)!

The Forum welcomes all (including alumni & general admission (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/gv6n19b)). But space is limited¬†‚Äî register today!

Check out our¬†recap of last year (https://t.e2ma.net/click/ssc4ro/c0zibuce/wn7n19b), which featured keynote speaker Peggy Yu Yu (Stern MBA '92), co-founder and executive chairwoman of Dangdang.com.

subject: üìà Turn Your Startup Idea into Reality with the NYU Accelerator Program!
body:
To view this email online, paste this link into your browser:
https://t.e2ma.net/message/4lfnro/c0zibuce





A Three-Part Accelerator to Turn Your Startup Vision Into Reality

 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/opba09b)

Are you a budding NYU founder with a big vision to create your startup?¬†The¬†Startup Accelerator Program (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/4hca09b)¬†provides early-stage entrepreneurs with the resources, money, and mentorship needed to build, launch, and scale their ventures.

Participants gain access to grant funding, expert mentorship, 24/7 co-working space, and more to propel their business ideas to new heights. Past teams have gone on to join¬†Techstars and¬†Y-Combinator, win the¬†NYU Entrepreneurs Challenge, earn spots on Forbes 30 Under 30 lists, and become¬†NYU Female Founders Fellows.

Stage 1:¬†Startup Bootcamps (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/kada09b) ‚Äì Three half-day workshops and a week of customer discovery interviews to validate your idea with target users. (Application deadline: Mon, March 3)

Stage 2: Startup Sprints (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/02da09b) ‚Äì A two-week intensive with tailored coaching to test and refine your business model.¬†(Application deadline: Wed, March 19)

Stage 3: Summer Launchpad (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/gvea09b)¬†‚Äì A nine-week accelerator where teams grow their customer base, connect with investors, and prepare to scale, with $15,000 in non-dilutive funding.¬†(Application deadline: Wed, March 19)

Want to join the ranks of alumni like¬†Brooklinen (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/wnfa09b),¬†Pepper (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/cgga09b), Jones (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/s8ga09b), Frich (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/80ha09b),¬†GigFinesse (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/otia09b), Baton (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/4lja09b), Sabai (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/keka09b),¬†She Matters (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/06ka09b), and¬†The Diversity Org (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/gzla09b)?

RSVP for an info session below to learn more!

Mon, Feb. 10, 4:30‚Äì5:30PM ET (at the Leslie eLab) (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/wrma09b)

Tue, Feb. 18, 4:30‚Äì5:30PM ET (at the Leslie eLab) (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/ckna09b)

Mon, Feb. 24, 4:00‚Äì6:00PM ET (at the NYU MakerSpace) (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/scoa09b)

Tue, March 11, 4:30‚Äì5:30PM ET (at the Leslie eLab) (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/84oa09b)

New to the Entrepreneurial Institute? Join us at a How to Start a Startup at NYU introductory session to discover how we empower¬†founders to become the next generation of startup leaders! We'll walk you through the programming, events, and funding available to support your goals. Upcoming Sessions: 2/12 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/oxpa09b), 2/20 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/4pqa09b), 2/24 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/kira09b), 3/5 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/0asa09b), and 3/10 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/g3sa09b).

Recap: The 2025 J-Term Startup Sprint (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/wvta09b)

From Jan. 6-17, seventeen NYU-founded ventures participated in our intensive accelerator to transform their ideas into scalable businesses. In total, the J-Term Sprint cohort conducted a combined 683 customer discovery interviews with target customers. Get to know the teams!¬†

The 2024 Summer Launchpad Cohort (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/coua09b)

Over nine weeks last summer, 12 of NYU's most promising ventures gathered at the Leslie eLab to reach key business milestones, acquire customers, and refine their business models. Meet each of the innovative startups and their founders from CAS, Courant, GSAS, SPS, Stern, Tandon, and Tisch!

Got questions? We want to hear from you! Send us an email at entrepreneur@nyu.edu¬†

entrepreneur.nyu.edu (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/sgva09b)

Crushing the NYU Startup Bootcamp: Q&A with Kyle Yang (Stern MBA  (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/88va09b)

Want a participant's first-hand perspective on the Startup Bootcamp?¬†Check out¬†this Q&A with Kyle Yang (Stern MBA '21), founder of War Locker (https://t.e2ma.net/click/4lfnro/c0zibuce/o1wa09b), a manufacturer of sports gear tailored to provide protection and comfort to athletes.

subject: [Special Blast]: Community, Mentorship, & Student Loan Relief By Advancing Gender Equity ‚ú®
body:
Discover the NYU Female Founders Fellowship!


To view this email online, paste this link into your browser:
https://t.e2ma.net/message/oxdtio/c0zibuce





Now Searching for the Spring '25 Cohort of the NYU Female Founders Fellowship!

 (https://t.e2ma.net/click/oxdtio/c0zibuce/w7u3c9b)

Working on a startup idea? Join the NYU Female Founders Fellowship (https://t.e2ma.net/click/oxdtio/c0zibuce/c0v3c9b)¬†and be part of a dynamic, empowering community committed to advancing gender equity in entrepreneurship!

As a Fellow, you‚Äôll gain access to exclusive monthly events, personalized 1:1 mentorship, priority office hours, and special networking opportunities. Plus, upon completion of the program, you‚Äôll be eligible to apply for game-changing student loan alleviation grants of up to $25,000.

The Fellowship is open to NYU students, faculty, and staff¬†who are building scalable startups. Interested in joining the Spring '25 Cohort? Applications are due Monday, Dec. 16 at 6pm ET. RSVP for an info session to learn more:

entrepreneur.nyu.edu (https://t.e2ma.net/click/oxdtio/c0zibuce/ssw3c9b)

Fri 11/1, 12:00‚Äì2:00PM ET (w/ Panel Discussion & Lunch) (https://t.e2ma.net/click/oxdtio/c0zibuce/8kx3c9b)

Tue 12/10, 4:00‚Äì5:30PM ET (https://t.e2ma.net/click/oxdtio/c0zibuce/ody3c9b)

We seek to build a diverse, inclusive cohort of Fellows. We welcome and encourage applications from any student, faculty, or staff member, regardless of gender, and including but not limited to those who identify as trans, gender non-conforming, non-binary, or genderqueer.¬†

Announcing the 2024 Mark & Debra Leslie Female Founders Fellows (https://t.e2ma.net/click/oxdtio/c0zibuce/45y3c9b)

This year, we welcome the addition of five new Mark &¬†Debra¬†Leslie Female Founders Fellows from Steinhardt, Tandon, CAS, Stern, and Wagner! Get to know this year's¬†Fellows, who will each receive student debt relief for their demonstrated support of gender equity in entrepreneurship.

Introducing: 6 New Members of the NYU Female Founders Fellowship (https://t.e2ma.net/click/oxdtio/c0zibuce/kyz3c9b)

We're honored to have accepted six new members to our Female Founders Fellowship during the Fall '24 semester! We invite you to learn more about the entrepreneurs from GSAS,¬†Langone, Steinhardt, Stern, and Tandon who were recently accepted into our robust community.

NYU Female Founders Circle¬†Welcomes 16 Members (https://t.e2ma.net/click/oxdtio/c0zibuce/0q03c9b)

Designed specifically for early-stage entrepreneurs, the Female Founders¬†Circle¬†connects¬†members¬†to invaluable startup resources and a dynamic community.¬†Meet the 16 founders we recently welcomed into the¬†Circle, who join us from¬†CAS, GPH, GSAS, Steinhardt, Stern, Tandon, Tisch, and the Center for Neural Science.





16 Washington Place | New York, NY 10011 US

subject: Fwd: Sign up for free Membership in The New York Academy of Sciences!
body:
Hi all:

Highlighting the below in case you are interested.

*Sign up for free Membership in The New York Academy of Sciences!*

For over 200 years, *The New York Academy of Sciences* has supported
scientists, engineers, and innovators as they pursue successful careers in
STEM. As an organizational Member of the Academy, *New York University will
sponsor free individual memberships *for interested graduate students and
postdocs from now until *October 16th.*

As an Academy Member, you‚Äôll benefit from access to the following benefits:

   - *Career Development Resources: *Access to webinars, workshops, and
   online courses
   <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Do_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=rJOpq8VPDyaDsyo-Rb0F84SGsB-O6b4IRixSn4p5GoM&e=>
centered
   on planning successful careers in STEM.
   - *Scientific Webinars & Events:* Discounted and free registration to
   online scientific events, symposia, and webinars
   <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Db_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=s5NJtp6yYDOFRnUU2rYM_A18W0JoEXGpjR6pC9BU7mc&e=>
presented
   at the Academy.
   - *Digital Content & Publications:* Unlimited access to digital
   publications
   <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dn_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=eoRU7S1zCfWT6cEuk91v1hyTLbzoYgCPxfiiAkDAbrs&e=>,
   including Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences, among the world‚Äôs
   most cited interdisciplinary scientific publications, and an archive of
   500+ eBriefings, multimedia reports on research presented at the Academy.
   - *Networking & Resume Building:* Opportunities to present your
   research, apply for intensive leadership training, become a mentor
   <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dp_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=Ah7dGO-Dkakbw18Q8z_USRQEpcJMkOtMX0WqwPqgGSc&e=>,
   and connect with other Members from our global Membership network,
using an online
   Directory
   <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dx_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=dKFlZDKb6VM6XbZlSnnHFrqzvINqNb32AUcGgWOlwYM&e=>
   .

*NYU's open enrollment window for NYAS membership will remain open until
October 16th.* Click below to sign up! If you have any questions please
reach out to Matt Jerram <mj3610@nyu.edu>.
Kathryn

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: GSAS Professional Development <gsas.profdev@nyu.edu>
Date: Fri, Sep 26, 2025 at 9:40‚ÄØAM
Subject: The Grapevine - September 26th, 2025 Issue
To: Kathryn Angeles <kangeles@nyu.edu>


<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dr_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=snEhyXYdFHVfDhJEx3YkqUli6Iu_LgeznLO4fd9HCAU&e=>

[image: The Grapevine]


This email serves as your *September 26th, 2025* newsletter for notable
professional development and fellowships news at NYU GSAS. Remember you can
stay up to date with all upcoming professional development events by
subscribing to our Google calendar
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dy_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=-QdewJ1jvlpdWfrE0myrWE1DK087GCyORzwsjI-udLU&e=>
!

If you have questions about the contents of this newsletter, please
contact *Abby
Williams* for Professional Development at gsas.profdev@nyu.edu or *Emily
Hollenbach *for Fellowships & Awards at gsas.fellowships@nyu.edu.

[image: Announcements]

*GSAS x Wasserman Internship Day with Wonsulting's Jerry Lee*

Are you interested in enhancing your graduate study with internship
experience? Mark your calendars for the return of our successful *GSAS x
Wasserman Internship Day*, an event specifically designed to help you
navigate the world of graduate internships.

*Date:* Friday, October 3, 2025
*Time:* 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM
*Location:* Hemmerdinger Hall, Silver Center for Arts and Science

This comprehensive event will provide you with the tools and insights to:

   - *Prepare* for an internship
   - *Find* opportunities
   - *Gain *a competitive edge

This year, we're excited to welcome *Jerry Lee *of *Wonsulting* as our
keynote speaker! As a former Senior Strategist for Google, a recognized
LinkedIn Top Voice for Tech, and a TEDx speaker, Jerry will provide insight
into navigating *resume standards*, share *insider knowledge** of hiring
practices* at top employers, and provide* tips for networking,
cold-calling, and maximizing your LinkedIn presence*.

Whether you're just starting your search or refining your strategy, this
event is packed with practical advice to set you on the path to success.
RSVP below!
Register
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dj_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=Jsxx33ayuT_D5iRKqk-MNSu5hU9QRjNHuCB1t6WCU58&e=>

*Register now for PhD Live!*

*PhD Live! *is a University-wide program that helps NYU PhD students
transform their complex research into clear and compelling stories for
broad audiences. Through workshops, coaching, and a live showcase, students
gain skills in writing, performance, and visual storytelling while building
confidence in sharing their work beyond academia. *All NYU PhD/JSD students
are eligible to apply! *

This year‚Äôs initiative includes 3 phases. Phase 1 of *PhD Live!* sets the
foundation for success, offering *two fall training sessions* focused on
writing, visual storytelling, and performance skills. These sessions will
be led by *Ben Lillie*, co-founder of The Story Collider and Moth StorySLAM
champion, *Carl Cofield*, chair of NYU Tisch's Graduate Acting
Program, and* Jane
Guyer Fujita*, Associate Arts Professor, Head of Voice and Speech in
Graduate Acting.

*Fall Training Sessions:*

   - *Session 1: *Thursday, October 16, 9-11am
   - *Session 2: *Monday, November 10, 9-11am
   - *Location:* Kimmel Center, 60 Washington Square S, Room 914, New York,
   NY 10012

The two Phase 1 sessions form a single training sequence, so *registration
requires in-person attendance at both sessions*. In addition, all
participants will join *two peer-led meetings* (via Zoom) to further
practice and refine skills. This is a special opportunity to connect and
collaborate with PhD peers from outside of your home department!

Following Phase 1, participants will be invited to apply for Phases 2 and 3
where they will receive additional training and audition for the final
showcase. The top eight students will perform and compete for *cash prizes* in
front of a live audience. Register now to participate!
Register
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dt_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=h1VzXTVhhUX7PGFqXvh5uWsNQVg2dTXoFsSEyXILuOc&e=>


[image: Upcoming Events]

*LinkedIn Rock your Profile*


*Monday, September 29th, 12:00-1:00PM Virtual*

LinkedIn as a virtual tool is more important than ever for staying relevant
and connected. Learn strategies for creating an effective profile for job
searching and networking from a LinkedIn representative. Q & A will follow.
Register
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Di_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=KzmhhncdtbroF6mogmBhu_b8eD0ngtePQqIkBDf3S2o&e=>

*What's My Story and How Can I Tell It?*


*Tuesday, September 30th, 12:30-4:00PM NYU Changemaker Center, 12
Washington Pl.*

This workshop is part of a collaborative series between the Social Impact
Career Hub and the Changemaker Center, designed to help students explore
purpose-driven career paths and leadership development. This session is for
students who are seeking to explore their personal story and learn how to
share it in a powerful way. You will reflect, map, and connect experiences
to develop a personal narrative, share your narrative, and receive
feedback. It is also an opportunity to, through the sharing of stories,
build community with peers. This event is open to all students but is
particularly relevant to students preparing for an interview, presentation,
or speaking engagement.
Register
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dd_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=tXuxmeICiQbv2lHXG7ppE9vlppcGDV0cw3CgW8dS9DU&e=>

*GSAS x Wasserman Alumni Playbook: From Classroom to Career*


*Wednesday, October 8th, 6:00PM-7:30PM Hemmerdinger Hall, Silver Center *

Unlock the secrets to career success with NYU GSAS and the Wasserman
Center! Hear from accomplished GSAS alumni as they share networking
strategies, career tips, and personal stories on building a strong
professional foundation. The event includes a panel discussion, interactive
Q&A, and a reception to connect with alumni and peers, offering valuable
opportunities to grow your network and career path. Food and drinks will be
served; space is limited!
Register
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dh_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=phVEsbTm-W3AZddnI3BVTN635FCw_Baydga5DYjSqtg&e=>
[image: Professional Development]
*Reminder: Apply now for a 2026-2027 Public Humanities Doctoral Fellowship!*

Applications for the *2026-2027 Public Humanities Doctoral Fellowship* are
due *October 8th at 11:59pm*. These academic year-long fellowships offer
advanced doctoral students in the humanities and social sciences the
opportunity to *gain public facing experience at a range of cultural and
educational institutions*. Students selected for these working
fellowships will be able to explore different modes of public engagement
and see firsthand how their extensive skills, knowledge, and talents can be
applied at such institutions, all while exploring diverse career options
available to PhD graduates.
Apply Now
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dk_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=XDi36CL5m7yKpUibXAZBTTy6S4tk30bp6cqEsOmLlyc&e=>
*Deadline extended: Wasserman International Student Career Academy*

Join NYU‚Äôs *International Student Career Academy*, an engaging five-session
program designed to empower international students with essential job
search skills and workplace readiness strategies. From self-awareness to
effective communication, this program equips you to confidently navigate
the U.S. job market and achieve your career goals.

*Program Schedule*

*September 29 | 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM *
Kickoff: Design Your Life Part 1 ‚Äì Your Values, Self-awareness, and Career
Paths

*October 6 | 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM*
Design Your Life Part 2 ‚Äì Capitalizing on Your Strengths and Decision-Making

*October 20 | 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM*
Understanding & Leveraging Communication Styles

*October 27 | 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM*
Emotional Intelligence & Mindfulness

*November 7 | 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM*
Final Celebration and Networking

*Apply below to participate!* Contact Marzena Ermler <m.ermler@nyu.edu> with
any questions.
Apply Now
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Du_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=ZNolnIWMb9phZCVT7ZZ9cqm4-jm656fSwOWUKrwPZsE&e=>

As an Academy Member, you‚Äôll benefit from access to the following benefits:

   - *Career Development Resources: *Access to webinars, workshops, and

centered

presented

The *Gates Cambridge *mission is to build a global network of future
leaders committed to improving the lives of others. The *Gates Cambridge
Scholarship* provides opportunities to outstanding applicants from
countries outside the UK to pursue a postgraduate degree in any subject
available at the University of Cambridge while being immersed in a vibrant
scholar community and alumni network. The Gates Cambridge mission aims to
build a global network of future leaders committed to improving the lives
of others.

*Open to:*

   - Citizens of any country outside of the United Kingdom
   - Applicants interested in a PhD (full-time or part-time), MLitt
   (full-time), or one year postgraduate course (full-time)

*2026-27 ASF Fellowships for Americans in the Nordic Countries*

*Benefits:*

   - Long-term fellowships (4-12 months) of up to $23,000
   - Short-term fellowships (1-3 months) of up to $5,000

*Application Deadline: November 1, 2025*

The American-Scandinavian Foundation (ASF) promotes firsthand exchange of
intellectual and creative influence between the United States and the
Nordic countries: Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, and Sweden. A publicly
supported American nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization, ASF has an extensive
program of fellowships, grants, intern/trainee sponsorship, publishing, and
cultural activities. Headquartered at Scandinavia House in New York City,
ASF has members throughout the United States, and alumni and donors
worldwide.

*Open to:*

   - U.S. citizens or permanent residents
   - Graduate students (preference for dissertation-related) and
   post-undergraduate academic professionals pursuing research or creative
   arts projects in Nordic region
   - Preference for some ability in Nordic language

*Lafayette Fellowship*

*Benefits:*

   - A ‚Ç¨1,500 monthly stipend from mid-July 2026 through the end of June
   2027 to cover living expenses
   - One year of tuition at a partner French institution for eligible
   programs
   - Application fee waivers for French academic institutions and master‚Äôs
   programs
   - Student visa fee waivers for one academic year
   - A round-trip flight to and from France at the start and end of the
   program
   - Coverage of travel costs and activities related to the French-American
   Leadership Program

*Application Deadline: November 30, 2025*

The *Lafayette Fellowship* is a prestigious new graduate fellowship in
France for tomorrow‚Äôs leaders. Partnering with 15 of the top French higher
education institutions, one year of master‚Äôs-level studies are available
across science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM); the
humanities and social sciences; and the arts, either in French or entirely
in English.

In addition to their academic studies, fellows will take part in the
French-American Leadership Program, which explores the future of the
transatlantic relationship and provides a 360-degree immersion into
European innovation, culture, and policy, as well as access to an
international network of mentors.

*Open to:*

   - U.S. citizens
   - Applicants who will be under 27 years of age on July 1, 2026
   - Possessors of a Bachelor‚Äôs degree from a U.S. institution earned
   between August 2023 and June 2026
   - 3.7 minimum GPA
   - STEM, humanities, social sciences, and arts students interested in
   addressing global challenges in a French-American context
   - French proficiency not required

*2026-27 Language Fellowships from the Blakemore Foundation*

*Blakemore Foundation Asian Language Fellowships* are awarded for one
academic year for the advanced study of Chinese (in Taiwan), Japanese,
Korean, Indonesian, Khmer, Thai, or Vietnamese in Asia. Study of Chinese at
Tsinghua University in Beijing is also available as a Blakemore Fellowship.

   - Have completed at minimum the third year of study of the Asian
   language, and ready to advance to professional fluency

*Blakemore Kingfisher Art History Language Fellowships *are awarded for

well-demonstrated intent to study the pre-twentieth century history of
Chinese or Korean art at the doctoral level.

   - U.S. and Canadian citizens or permanent residents and foreign
   nationals studying in U.S. or Canadian colleges
   - Interest in pursuing doctoral degree in pre-twentieth century Chinese
   or Korean art history
   - Have completed at minimum the second year of study of the Asian
   language in rigorous college-level language programs

*2026 Leadership Fellow Program at Port Authority of NY & NJ*

The Leadership Fellow Program is a *two-year rotational program* at The
Port Authority of New York & New Jersey* open to students who are receiving
a graduate degree between December 2025 and June 2026.* Over the span of
two years, Leadership Fellows have an opportunity to rotate through four
different business functions: staff/support department, line department,
finance, and facility operations. Through structured rotational
assignments, Fellows gain a broad understanding of the agency‚Äôs structure,
goals, and strategic direction while actively contributing to departmental
initiatives. Beyond the responsibilities in each rotation, Fellows also
engage in continuous learning and leadership development through training
sessions, mentorship, and feedback.

*Applications are due November 1st*.
Read More
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dtl_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=_WyW-ZFHbOUpG0DsQD-JUpF_lp7qMyGOQV7Thu-nBUc&e=>

*Help GSAS Build a Graduate Internship Database!*

We are beginning the work to build a searchable database for current
student and departmental use to see what internships GSAS students have
held in the past (including companies, NGOs, NPOs, etc.), and to understand
how we can better support students interested in pursuing internships.

*We're asking all graduate students who are interested in or have
completed internship experiences to fill out this survey
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dtr_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=9A_xnrt_7MWbFc4iyOYHFsCuec_5e9J9gqDewqxDrPs&e=>.*
This
is an important tool for us to understand how students find internships,
difficulties in securing internships, and how we can better support you.

While we work on the database, don't forget to check out the
GSAS Internship Hub
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail20.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaikty-2Dihqkukuuh-2Dty_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=vddKjYo3Rh7RLEmvo1ia5lTNzTxKZLOO7jctj1BUYEtV5u3IJ2aR1odMcYplbf1r&s=OhYQdwuN5-j4phP2J1iGQBc6uUClSQethlblHPbfn2g&e=>,

and tips for preparing application materials.

subject: Fwd: Student Mentors Wanted for GSAS Mentorship Program 2025-26!
body:
Hi Students:

See below for an opportunity that may be of interest to you.

Kathryn

Kathryn Angeles
Senior Director, Academic Affairs and Operations
Center for Data Science
New York University
Phone: 212.998.3367

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: GSAS Mentorship Program <gsas.mentorship@nyu.edu>
Date: Mon, Sep 22, 2025 at 2:01‚ÄØPM

The Graduate School of Arts and Science is excited to announce that *we are
actively seeking student mentors* for the *GSAS Mentorship Program
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail19.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaluhl-2Dhllddrkjty-2Dr_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=m74ylNLCP7e45f1ONoGYg9XzTLjcOPZiAgClc5BdUEP5hLQ73UtrEf9d5V-eDXcf&s=tblEyp0fJfQzDriq3f8hOgfJWKuN1xgViX1E3MR69tA&e=>*
.

The GSAS Mentorship Program aims to enhance graduate students' growth at
NYU and facilitate student success. This* peer-to-peer mentorship program*
matches students *across disciplines and departments* based on student
interests and demographic preferences. The Mentor application is open to *2nd
year and beyond* Master's and Ph.D. students within GSAS.

The GSAS Mentorship Program is a way for GSAS *graduate students to connect
with one another* on personal, academic, and professional levels. The
Program will match students with mentees for an *informal* mentorship for
the 2025-2026 academic year.

Those who become mentors build better, mutual connections within the NYU
community, enhancing their social experiences in and outside of the
classroom. Mentors improve their leadership and management skills, which
are incredibly useful for future fellowship programs as well as academic
careers. Finally, and most importantly, mentors benefit by sharing their
knowledge to students who are in need of direction in their graduate
studies.

Mentors should anticipate meeting with their mentees a *minimum of two (2)
times per semester*. Programming will also be taking place throughout the
year where students will have the chance to connect with one another and
access a variety of opportunities!

Please direct any interested students to *apply through this
application form
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__nyugsasstudentaffairs.cmail19.com_t_d-2Dl-2Dgaluhl-2Dhllddrkjty-2Dy_&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=1wrcCdxHt8V-4S3xQtf28AOpurU3n1poXXp6kaFELYU&m=m74ylNLCP7e45f1ONoGYg9XzTLjcOPZiAgClc5BdUEP5hLQ73UtrEf9d5V-eDXcf&s=vbj3l5k9bUFBM78TT_pkfE5KAojPAtXMkA8cHIx3e-0&e=>*.
The deadline for applications is *Friday, **September 26th, 2025*.

If you have any questions, please email us at gsas.mentorship@nyu.edu.


Best,
Office of Academic and Student Affairs

Part-Time Job Opportunity: Graduate Assistant - Multimodal LLMs for Learning

We are recruiting for an exciting part-time opportunity for a Graduate
Assistant to help in the multimodal LLM aspects of a project that models
learning behaviors.  This position would work closely with the project lead
to operationalize a pipeline to parse multimodal signals from audio, image,
and video data of learners.  The selected candidate will work 10 hours per
week starting in October 2025. Please see the complete job description and
application information here
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1V31FsZBHu_T4rVH5OC4MhEewPM-h4mjX66XkrjuB3F4/>.
Applications close on October 1, 2025.

subject: Resource: Providing Feedback/Issues/Suggestions to CDS
body:
Hi Students:

I hope that you all had a great summer and are having a great start to the
semester! I wanted to share the various options you have for
providing feedback, issues, and/or suggestions to CDS.

*NYU CDS Form for Feedback/Issues/Suggestions
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdukrgiiTCb-X87RbFmhzTldjpLptdveKRSwruAu_Ifq_mk0g/viewform>
(CDS
Staff)*
We have created an online form
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdukrgiiTCb-X87RbFmhzTldjpLptdveKRSwruAu_Ifq_mk0g/viewform>
for
NYU CDS feedback, issues, and suggestions. While the form can be submitted
anonymously, we encourage you to provide as much information as possible as
a dialogue about the issue may help us take appropriate actions. Please
note that this is a resource to make the CDS community more inclusive, it
is not meant to be used for the purpose of reporting discrimination,
harassment, sexual misconduct, or a Title IX complaint. Such reports should
be made to NYU's Office of Equal Opportunity ("OEO"). More information
about OEO policies is available at
https://www.nyu.edu/about/policies-guidelines-compliance/equal-opportunity.html)
or to your supervisor or unit head.

This form will remain open and accessible to the CDS community on a
consistent basis. The form results will be reviewed by CDS staff. If you
have any questions or concerns, you can also reach out to us directly (see
below for link to staff page <https://cds.nyu.edu/staff/>).

*Physical Suggestion Boxes*
There are physical suggestion boxes on the 7th floor (front reception
desk), 6th floor (front reception desk), and the 2nd floor (in the
kitchen). If you have a suggestion or feedback that you would like to
share, please feel free to submit one of the provided index cards (PhD =
yellow card, MS = pink card, Undergraduate = orange card) to any of these
boxes. Name and contact information are not required, but please feel free
to provide if you would like a staff member to follow-up with you.

The boxes will be kept locked and checked on a monthly basis.

*Email CDS Staff Directly *
You are also welcome to email CDS staff directly with any of your
suggestions, feedback, and/or concerns. A list of staff can be found at
https://cds.nyu.edu/staff/.

If you have any questions, please let me know.

Thanks!
Kathryn

Kathryn Angeles
Senior Director, Academic Affairs and Operations
Center for Data Science
New York University
Phone: 212.998.3367

subject: Re: Dissertation Defense Presentation: Guy Davidson - August 7 at 11:30am
body:
Hi all:

Sorry for the last-minute change, but Guy's defense this morning will now
be in the CDS Open Space (60 5th Avenue, 7th floor).

Kathryn

Kathryn Angeles
Senior Director, Academic Affairs and Operations
Center for Data Science
New York University
Phone: 212.998.3367


On Tue, Aug 5, 2025 at 4:34‚ÄØPM Kathryn Angeles <kangeles@nyu.edu> wrote:

> Hi all:
>
> Sorry for the additional email, but due to a conflict, Guy's defense
> presentation is now scheduled for 11:30am on August 7 (all other details
> are the same).
>
> Thanks!
> Kathryn
>
> Kathryn Angeles
> Senior Director, Academic Affairs and Operations
> Center for Data Science
> New York University
> Phone: 212.998.3367
>
>
> On Mon, Aug 4, 2025 at 10:24‚ÄØAM Kathryn Angeles <kangeles@nyu.edu> wrote:
>
>> Hi all:
>>
>> I am writing to invite you to Guy Davidson's dissertation defense presentation on
>> Thursday, August 7 at 11am. Guy is an August 2025 graduation candidate for
>> the PhD in Data Science, who is advised by Brenden Lake and Todd Gureckis.
>> See below for details.
>>
>>    - *Title *- Goals as Reward-Producing Programs
>>    - *Abstract *- Goals are a prevalent idea across the cognitive
>>    sciences, and as the basis for agentic and motivated behavior, have been of
>>    interest to psychologists since the field's inception. The human concept of
>>    a goal is remarkably flexible: from the representation of a single goal, be
>>    it self-proposed or externally provided, we can plan how to pursue the
>>    goal, propose similar ones, evaluate progress toward a goal, and infer how
>>    well it aligns with observed behavior. How do we do it? What sort of
>>    representation might offer such behavioral flexibility? How do we even
>>    define a goal? Its ubiquity notwithstanding, the term 'goal' is often left
>>    undefined in psychological work, and when definitions are provided, they
>>    can suffer from inconsistency and a lack of technical rigor. Unlike
>>    psychology, approaches in artificial intelligence have offered technically
>>    precise definitions of goals, driven by the necessity to implement and
>>    evaluate ideas in code. However, here the definitions provided are often
>>    ones of convenience, reducing goals to target states of the world to
>>    achieve. While technically successful, these definitions fail to capture
>>    the rich, creative, and often idiosyncratic goals people routinely create
>>    for themselves and for others. This dissertation offers a path forward by
>>    empirically studying human-created goals and proposing a program-based
>>    representation I term *reward-producing programs *that can capture
>>    the complexity of human goals.  I then leverage these representations to
>>    build computational models of goal generation and goal inference in two
>>    different settings, and conclude with a foray into studying similar
>>    questions in large language models.
>>    - *Defense Presentation Date and Tim**e* - August 7 at 11am
>>    - *Location *- In-person: CDS Room 650 (6th Floor) at 60 5th Avenue
>>    (access to NYU buildings required) or via Zoom
>>    <https://nyu.zoom.us/j/94265399874?pwd=pRalCJ7pXzBbgBhwMlwhNEq7LMJzMH.1>
>>
>> Thanks!
>> Kathryn
>>
>> Kathryn Angeles
>> Senior Director, Academic Affairs and Operations
>> Center for Data Science
>> New York University
>> Phone: 212.998.3367
>>
>

Lunch with Mengye Ren, Assistant Professor of Computer Science and Data Science
body:
Dear Students,

We are excited to share that the first faculty/student lunch will be held on
 *Thursday, October 9 from 12:30pm-1:30pm* with Mengye Ren, Assistant
Professor of Computer Science and Data Science (https://mengyeren.com/). These
lunches are an opportunity for a group of about 10-12 students to connect
with CDS faculty outside of class.

If you are interested in participating in this lunch, please register here
- https://cdsfall2025lunchMengyeRen.eventbrite.com. As this is a small
group lunch, spots are very limited.

*Please make sure to only register if you are able to attend. No-shows or
last minute cancellations will result in not being permitted to register
for a future event. Additionally, make sure to sign-up for the correct
ticket type (MS or PhD) or your ticket will be cancelled, if incorrect.*

*Note: This event is for CDS graduate students only. Please do not forward
it to others.*

Best,
Francheska

-- 
Francheska Jimenez, M.A.
Assistant Director of Academic & Student Affairs
Center for Data Science
E: fj6@nyu.edu
T: 212-998-3358
60 Fifth Ave., 7th floor
New York, NY 10011

My office is a *S**A**FE ZONE* for individuals of all ethnicities,
abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and gender identities.
